ACCE; CE; Property; FEM TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 With IBM FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM), we can follow the steps below to overwrite the property definition in a document class

1. Launch FEM
2. Expand the object store and document class tree. Right click on the document class and select "Properties"
3. Go to "Properties Definitions" tab, highlight the property definition and click "Edit"
4. Make the modification and click OK
5. Click OK again to save the change

How to perform the same operation with FileNet Content Engine - ACCE? 

ANSWER
Follow the below steps to update the property definition properties on ACCE: 




 1. Launch ACCE 
 2. Expand the object stores folder and click the object store to open the Object store tab 
 3. Expand the Data Design folder and Classes folder. Click the document class to open Document Class tab 
 4. From Properties tab, open Property Definitions drop down and select the property definition you want to modify 
 5. ACCE will open that property definition in a new Properties tab 
 6. Modify the property definition as required 
 7. Go back to the Class Definition tab and click Save

   ===== State: Engineering by:vladeruk at 5/27/2015 4:29:34 AM
   =====
   
   After debugging it I understand that Rhapsody doesn't support
   active classes with activity diagrams. At least, I don't see
   "startDispatching" calls and all actions are performed in the
   context of main thread.
   We should discuss this issue here in dev lab. It sounds like
   limitation and I'm not sure there is an easy way to solve it. It
   looks like some design changes should be done in both framework
   and code generator to solve the issue.
   
   ===== State: EngineeringComplete by:vladeruk at 5/27/2015
   3:30:07 AM =====
   
   One more thought: I guess, the problem is related to thread
   scheduling policy. Probably, if it would be some round robin
   algorithm or another kind of prioritizing then it could work.
   But in Windows the thread, which takes control and doesn't call
   any synchronization API, continues working and doesn't switch to
   another waiting thread.
   
   ===== State: EngineeringComplete by:vladeruk at 5/27/2015
   3:07:26 AM =====
   
   Hi Alex,
   
   Application is working according to UML specification. If you
   need more explanation, please, ask Eldad Palachi, whom I
   discussed the issue before answering you. He is our main
   UML/SysML expert.
   
   Using of timeout (btw, it can be used with duration=0, which
   causes only context switching) is not workaround. Original model
   actually defines endless loop. It is like "while(true);"
   statement is written in C program.
   
   Probably, user should change Activity::General::SimulationMode
   property to use StateOriented semantics. But I'm not familiar
   with this area .
   
   Regards,
   Vova
   
   ===== State: EngineeringComplete by:aaratzlo at 5/27/2015
   12:26:36 AM =====
   
   Thanks so much for the help Vova.
   
   The customer, who is an IBMer, does think the implementation
   still isn't working correctly. Here are is full comments:
   
   "I can see that breaking the loop with a timer will make the
   model work, however I think that's a bit of a hack. The whole
   purpose of using threads (Active Concurrency) is to support the
   type of modelling done in the model. It appears changing the
   concurrency setting has no effect then? Eldad in development
   thought that it should :)
   
   I think the timer is a workaround, but the implementation
   doesn't work as expected."
   
   Any ideas on that?
   
   Thanks again!!
   
   
   
   ===== State: Engineering by:vladeruk at 5/25/2015 11:05:24 AM
   =====
   
   It seems to me it is correct behavior. Since activity diagram
   contains endless loop, it doesn't switch context from one thread
   to another one.
   If you add time event after operation in both activity diagrams
   (A and B), then active context will switch. BTW, its duration
   can be 0.

TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 I am trying to run some Reports on my string data under Analyze->Reports->Report Summaries in Rows in SPSS 13.0.x and later. My variables are open-ended questions where the text may contain between 500 to 1000 characters. When I try to run this report I receive an alert message:

"The report requested is too wide. It requires a width of nnn characters but the report area width within the specified margins is 255 characters. The maximum width is 255 characters."

I then click OK and no output is created.

I have attempted to change my margins by going under Edit->Options, Viewer tab, but even the Custom Settings under "Text Output Page Size" will not allow me to go above 255 characters.

If SPSS now allows string variables to be more than 255 characters shouldn't I be able to obtain output on them under the Reports option? 

RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
This issue has been noted and has been filed with SPSS Development as a feature request that Report allow more than 255 characters in the output.

One way of obtaining a report-like output on your wide string responses is to use the Summarize command with the Output Management System (OMS) and saving the file out as a Text (.txt) file.

The syntax below is an example of how you may do this. Please note that it is not necessary to edit the resulting SPSS Output. Simply open the newly created .txt file (longstring.txt in this example) in Notepad to view your responses:

OMS /select tables /destination format=text outfile = 'c:\temp\longstring.txt'
/if labels = 'Case Summaries'
.
SUMMARIZE
/TABLES=yourvariable
/FORMAT=LIST NOCASENUM NOTOTAL
/TITLE='Case Summaries'
/MISSING=VARIABLE
/CELLS=NONE.

omsend .

RELATED INFORMATION
 Need more help? Our Statistics forum is Live! [https://developer.ibm.com/answers/topics/statistics.html?smartspace=predictive-analytics]


 

HISTORICAL NUMBER
 55674

   Brian Roots/Columbia/IBM@IBMUS

   Subject
   Re: A couple of questions re: BPF
   Hi Hannu.
   1.
   I'm a little unclear on the first one, possibly because I
   don't have the document the customer is referring to.  It
   sounds like they did get 256-char comments working/displaying,
   but they had to do something more than increase the size of the
   Bp8Description CE property to do so?
   Several things here.  Just increasing the size of the CE
   property should be enough.  It works for me.  But that is
   assuming there are some wordbreaks, since the
   \css\Bp8Styles.css defines the following attribute for the
   Comment cell on the Audit Tab -
   .tblAuditDataWrap{
       word-wrap:break-word;
   }
   - and the code in \xsl\Bp8CaseAudit.xsl picks it up from there.
   In other words,
   aaaaaaaaaabbbbbbbbbbccccccccccddddddddddeeeeeeeeeeffffffffffggg
   ggggggghhhhhhhhhhiiiiiiiiiijjjjjjjjjjkkkkkkkkkkllllllllllmmmmmm
   mmmmnnnnnnnnnnoooooooooopppppppppp
   will "work" in the sense that the data will be saved to CE,
   but it won't display well in BPF because the value will go off
   the page.  I don't know of any easy way around that, short of
   adding scrollbars to the Audit Tab.
   But
   aaaaaaaaaa bbbbbbbbbb cccccccccc dddddddddd eeeeeeeeee
   ffffffffff gggggggggg hhhhhhhhhh iiiiiiiiiijjjjjjjjjj
   kkkkkkkkkk llllllllll mmmmmmmmmm nnnnnnnnnn oooooooooo
   pppppppppp
   will work fine.  Wrapping will occur and the whole value will
   be visible.
   We used to code a 64-char limit (maxlength) in the BPF Reasons
   dialog (where this value would be entered) - i.e. on
   Bp8Choices.xsl,  But we removed it to permit easy
   configuration of the size of this field as per the above.
   What version of BPF is this customer using?
   Of course, it may be necessary to increase the size of the
   Bp8Description field in two places in CE - both for the
   stand-alone property template and for that property as it
   exists on the Bp8AuditLogItem custom object class.
   Other than those considerations, I'm not sure what the problem
   could be.
   But I am still not sure exactly what the problem is.  Are they
   not able to enter more than 64 characters?  Or, if they do,
   do only the first 64 characters get saved to CE?  Or is it just
   a problem displaying them because they are entering values with
   no spaces or word breaks and the values are going off the
   screen?
   If it *is* just a matter of changing the length of
   Bp8Description in CE and whether we support it, the answer
   is, yes, we support it - but like all such customizations,
   the customer has too keep track of this change.  If they ever
   upgrade their system and import a new BPF CE manifest
   (ce_base.xml), it will reset the length of this property back
   to the default (64) and they will have to go in and change it
   back to 256 themselves manually.
   2.
   Yes.  This is a problem.  It looks like the whole section
   ("Step 2: Bundle code") of the "Web custom tool development
   procedure" section of the BPF Developer Guide is very much out
   of date (even in the new 3.6.0 version) - going back to the
   pre-product (pre-3.5.x) days when we distributed the actual
   source code to customers.
   Fortunately, none of the other parallel sections I looked at
   seems to share this problem.  And the "BPF Customization &
   Integration Development.doc" in the CODE_SAMPLES.zip that
   accompanies the Developer Guide does contain the correct and
   up-to-date procedure.
   So, for now, I would point the customer to the sample code
   and to that document.  Basically, they just need to compile
   their servlet in a JAR file using whatever name they like for
   the JAR and whatever internal packaging/directory structure
   they like there - and then deploy their custom JAR in the
   WEB-INF directory and make sure that their custom tool's JSP
   references the servlet using the correct package structure and
   naming.
   Could you please create a documentation DTS for this issue in
   the Developer Guide?  Many thanks.
   *

   information here and, if so, specify as precisely as you can
   what that might be.

Fixlets; content; patches; sites; cache; enable; Server; Patch; Console; Gathering; Missing Content; googlebigfix TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 Missing the current patch Fixlets, I can see older patches in my TEM Console but not the latest ones. 

CAUSE
 

1. Not Gathering
2. License Expired
3. Stale console Cache
4. Content is Not Relevant
5. Firewall/Proxy change
6. Service account issues


RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
From the TEM Server; 

1. Run the Tivoli Endpoint Manager Diagnostics utility: 

 a. Click the "Services" tab.
[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=1] 

 b. Click the "View Server Diagnostics" button. 


[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=2] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=2] 

 c. Click the "Gather Status Page" directly under "Site Gathering Information" text 


[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21591141&aid=3] 

 d. Check the gather status of your site(s) for Failed:, Ready:, and Pending: sections 

 e. Check the version of your site(s) for the missing Fixlets in question to see if the version is current. 

 For Example: to check the bessuport site: 


Id: 1 Date: Thu, 07 Mar 2013 10:22:19 +0000 Version: 1040
Url: http://sync.bigfix.com/cgi-bin/bfgather/bessupport 

 

 f. Try copying and pasting the above URL into an Internet Browser on your server, check to see what the reply is. 

 

 

2. Check the License Overview Dashboard, from the TEM Console > Dashboards > BES Support > License Overview. If your license is expired please contact the license department at tem@dk.ibm.com and please provide them with your license Serial Number. 

 

3. Clear your TEM Console Cache, by going to File > Preferences and click on the Clear Cache button. Exit the console and log back in. 

 

4. Select the "Show Non-Relevant Content" button on the console to see if the missing Fixlets show up. 

 

5. Look in the BESRelay.log file located in the, example default path: C:\Program Files (x86)\BigFix Enterprise\BES Server\BESRelay.log file. Are there any recorded errors? 

 

6. Firewall/Proxy changes? in many cases using a protocol analyzer is required to troubleshoot issues to determine what is blocking the update. You will want to look for interactions with the following sites: http://sync.bigfix.com, http://esync.bigfix.com and http://gatherer.bigfix.com. 

 

Please see the Proxy Technotes for further proxy setting configurations. 

How do I use TEM with a proxy? [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21505994] 

 

7. In one case, PCAP - Invalid checksum errors, were determined to be the cause from the Server's Network Interface Card (NIC). After disabling the checksum offloading the content was gathered. Please verify with your IT team for assistance and Policy. 

See the following - Disable-NetAdapterChecksumOffload: http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj130902.aspx [http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj130902.aspx] 

or 

http://wiki.wireshark.org/CaptureSetup/Offloading [http://wiki.wireshark.org/CaptureSetup/Offloading]


 

8. Verify that the user account of the services, BES Root Server and BES Gather, that the account's permissions have not changed or password expired? 

 

 

Note: In some cases where all of the above has been performed and checked out OK, but you still do not see the latest content. Try removing the site, then re-Enable and subscribe computers to the site by; 

 

 From the License Overview dashboard 

 - Open the Site in question and select the Remove option 

 - The site will reappear in the list of available sites with the Enable option in front of it. Click on Enable 

 - Subscribe your computers to the site again. 

 

If the problem still persists, please contact TEM Support team.

answer:
Follow the below steps to update the property definition properties on ACCE: 




 1. Launch ACCE 
 2. Expand the object stores folder and click the object store to open the Object store tab 
 3. Expand the Data Design folder and Classes folder. Click the document class to open Document Class tab 
 4. From Properties tab, open Property Definitions drop down and select the property definition you want to modify 
 5. ACCE will open that property definition in a new Properties tab 
 6. Modify the property definition as required 
 7. Go back to the Class Definition tab and click Save

ABSTRACT
This document provides information on the IBM DataPower Gateway Firmware Support Lifecycle.

CONTENT
IBM® DataPower® Gateway is a purpose-built gateway that provides security, traffic control, mediation and optimized access to a full range of mobile, web, application programming interface (API), service-oriented architecture (SOA), B2B and cloud workloads. It supports multi-cloud deployment and is available in Docker container, Linux application, VMware virtual machine and physical appliance form factors.

IBM provides flexible support options to meet the needs of your business and minimize any business impact. The IBM DataPower Gateways end-of-service support policy applies differently between hardware and firmware.

Hardware 

DataPower physical appliance hardware is supported for a minimum of five years, starting at the General Availability of the new product. Beginning with the 8436 models, standard appliance service and support is available for five years from the end-of-marketing (EOM) date as described in the IBM Appliance Support Handbook [http://www.ibm.com/support/customercare/sas/f/applhandbook/home.html].

For end-of-service information on physical appliances, see IBM DataPower Gateways End of Service dates [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21317845]. 

Firmware 

Businesses are building modernized digital platforms to drive innovation and disruption within the industry. IBM DataPower Gateways are a core component in these platforms and it needs to deliver new business functionality to keep pace with business innovation.

Effective with DataPower Gateway firmware V7.6 [https://www.ibm.com/common/ssi/cgi-bin/ssialias?infotype=AN&subtype=CA&htmlfid=897/ENUS217-265&appname=USN], DataPower introduces a Continuous Delivery (CD) model to accelerate delivery of new capabilities and meet market needs. DataPower CD will consist of two releases:

 1. CD release approximately once per quarter  * Only the most recent CD release is supported at a given time.
    
    
 2. Long Term Support (LTS) release every 12 months.  * LTS releases are for customer seeking enhanced stability and do not wish to upgrade on the CD schedule, while CD releases are intended for customers seeking the latest features.
     * The first LTS release post 7.6 GA will be within two years. Subsequent LTS releases will occur every 12 months.
     * LTS releases will be supported for a minimum of 2 years.
    
    

Firmware V7.6 and later have no extended support plan available for any release of DataPower Gateway. IBM will publish a notice of support discontinuance (end-of-service) for a LTS releases at least 12 months before the effective date.

Firmware V7.5 and earlier will remain on the traditional IBM DataPower Gateway support model where they will be supported for a minimum of 2 years. There is no extended support plan available for any of these releases. IBM will publish a notice of support discontinuance (end-of-service) for releases at least 12 months before the effective date.

Note: IBM DataPower Gateways customers can use the following table to track how long their version and release of a particular firmware level will be supported. By using the information in this table, customers can effectively plan their firmware investment without any gaps in support.

ABSTRACT
 Paul Miller, Rick Gillaspy, Raji Akella, Chris Majoros and Don Kutach led a discussion of what's new with IBM Notes Traveler Clients. See below for the Q&A, presentation and an audio recording of the event. 

CONTENT
 

Presentation NotesTraveler_OpenMic_16_July_2014.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27042157&aid=2]NotesTraveler_OpenMic_16_July_2014.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27042157&aid=1] 


Audio Replay 
What's New in Notes Traveler - Open Mic - 16July2014.mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27042157&aid=4]What's New in Notes Traveler - Open Mic - 16July2014.mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27042157&aid=3] 

References 
Using MobileIron with IBM Notes Traveler Companion and ToDo for Apple iOS devices [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/dx/Using_MobileIron_with_IBM_Notes_Traveler_Companion_and_ToDo_for_Apple_iOS_devices?OpenDocument&sa=true] 

BlackBerry Article ID: KB35547 - IBM Notes Traveler To Do and Memo (Journal) Support on BlackBerry 10 OS [http://www.blackberry.com/btsc/KB35547] 


Q&A  * iOS 
 * BlackBerry 
 * Policies 
 * Troubleshooting 
 * How to and General Q&A 
 * Feature Enhancement Requests & Roadmaps






iOS 

Q1. Are there plans for a full Traveler app for iOS as it is currently for Android? 
Yes, we are working on a Traveler client for iOS. First availability of Traveler iOS currently targeted for 4Q 14 


Q2. When will the Traveler client for iOS be coming out? 
Currently targeted for 2014 Q4 


Q3. I like this new Android client. When can we expect to have the same for iOS? 
Projected availability for the iOS client remains 4Q 2014 


Q4. Any Beta - like to get a preview? 
No formal plans now, but we are looking at what type of beta options iOS8 may allow for us 


Q5. Does the new Traveler release fix the issue of not being able to see items in trash on iPhone? 
- This is an Android-only update 
- No Trash support yet for iOS or Android. High priority for 4Q 2014 availability though. 


Q6. For iOS devices, we need to periodically reset them. otherwise, they do not sync Inbox or calendar. Is this issue got fixed in this version? 
Per Apple, this should now be resolved if using iOS 7.1.2, with Traveler server v9 or later 


Q7. Is there Notebook support for iOS? 
No notebook/journal for iOS either planned at this time 





BlackBerry 

Q8. What about Journals - Domino Lotus Journals. Will we see them eventually on Traveler on BlackBerry? 
Right now, Journal or Notebook support (across platforms) is not a high priority requirement right now. We get occasional reports but it hasn't bubbled to hitting the high-priority list. 


Q9. Do we have to have BES to use Traveler on BlackBerry device? 
No. You can use a BES or be standalone. 


Q10. Is Traveler client available on BlackBerry apps? Like it's available for Android? 
There is no specific Traveler Client. These are all built in to the normal OS. You just use a Traveler account. 


Q11. What BlackBerry models support Traveler 9.x.x? 
BlackBerry 10 supports Traveler straight off for mail and calendar. Todo's need version 10.2 or later. 


Q12. When will Memo (Notebook/Journal) synch be implemented for Blackberry 10? The BB KB article says "The BlackBerry 10 smartphone does not synchronize Memos (Journal) with Notes Traveler using SyncML protocol due to Notes Traveler 
limitation." 
Memo support is "in the works". No ETA at present. 





Policies 

Q13. Any tips on determining if a policy has been applied to a device? 
- The user dump shows the policy state 
- The Traveler admin ui for device security should also reflect policy status. A user dump will show if the Domino policy has actually been pushed to the mail 
database for the user. 
- You can look into the mail database (using NotesPeek). Look there for a traveler specific profile document. 


Q14. How do you do the user dump? command syntax? 
tell traveler dump <userid> 
The resulting log file will be in the ../traveler/logs/dumps directory 


Q15. If Adminp is involved how much of a time lag should you expect for a policy change to get applied? Any manually way to push it? 
- Traveler policies should get pushed automatically nightly once they are replicated to the mail servers. 
- You can manually push with Domino console. Command:  *  tell adminp pr tr on each mail server 



Q16. Do explicit policies take precedence over the default Device Settings? Are there issues with policies when Traveler is in a different Domino Domain? 
Domino Traveler policies do take precedence over default device setting. For different Domino domains you will need to define the policy in each Domain as adminp task on mail server push the policy to the users mail file at which point Traveler detects it. 


Q17. Has there been any security enhancement made to prevent information from a corporate email being copied and pasted into personal email. 
Copy and paste within email is controlled via a server policy 





Troubleshooting 

Q18. Are other people have the carriage return issue on the new Android Traveler App? 
Yes. We are already working on a fix. 


Q19. There's an issue with us having duplicate addresses. When we sync our address books, it seems to have duplicate addresses. Is there any relation to it with the version that we're running on or something with Traveler? 
We don't have any known issues in that area at all. Open a PMR. You might have a 3rd party app that is trying to sync as well; we have seen some duplication issues from things like that. 


Q20. Per slide 4, we have run into issues with Android app running after download via the traveler site we have. We'd rather not get the app via Google Play. Has this been fixed? 
How you download the application shouldn't matter as it is the same apk either way. If you have issues with the download from your server, then you possibly have some network issue that needs to be solved rather than an issue with the apk itself. 


Q21. It was a couple months ago with Galaxy S4 and believe me, nothing wrong with the server. The program downloaded just fine, but it didn't launch. 
You'll need to open a PMR so that we can debug what is going on there. 


Q22. On calendar, if you click an appointment in the device calendar it will link you directly to the Calendar app. On Contacts there is nothing happening; therefore, you have to got manually to the Contacts app in order to change a Device contact. 
Yes, that is the current behavior, on the list to improve going forward. 


Q23. Regarding issues with slowness to launch...  * love the new app on Android, but.....it's very slow to launch (slow as in 10 seconds to open mail)....and I have a Samsung Galaxy S4 Active 
 * Same here with multiple devices, also slowness on Contacts app 
 * I installed this on two phones and both phones took up to 30 seconds each time the mail app was opened. a Note and an S3 so I'd not consider those phones "underpowered". Traveler 9 on the two phones (S3 and Note) was slow enough to be unusable. Removing 9 and putting 8 back on instantly resolved the slowness. Slow as 30 seconds each time the mail app was opened from the home screen. Comments? 
 * my email opens in sub-secs - response time is good


Slowness improvements are in progress. Stay tuned for further updates 

Regarding the slowness to launch, we have had a few reported cases, and are continuing the investigation and reviewing reported cases. If you are able please open a PMR to report further slowness related issues with a TPR from the device. 






How to and General Q&A 

Q24. Is the confirmation for external recipient feature still available in the new app? 
Yes, no change to confirmation for external recipient behavior 


Q25. Are you able to add functionality to the Notes Traveler interface? 
Do you mean on the devices? if so, the answer is no as the apps aren't extendable 


Q26. Are they extendable or customizable on the server at all? 
The server side (default settings, web admin, servlet pages) aren't extendable 


Q27a. On the one hand Traveler is recommended in extra domain for being able to upgrade it independent from the mailing environment. On the other hand using ID Vault does not support Cross Domain? 
Remember that Domino is "future compatible" on names.nsf versions, so you can upgrade that without updating the whole server 


Q27b. And what is the answer, if I am providing a central Traveler Cluster for many (Mail) Domains? 
If you have multiple mail domains, you already have the ID vault cross domain issue, so having Traveler in another domain is only a real problem if you have all of your mails in one domain because if you have them in separate domains, you already have the ID vault problem. The people who own ID vault are aware of the issue and addressing it was mentioned at Connect 2014. 


Q28. We're running on 8.5.3 mail servers and applications, but our actual Traveler sits on a different domain. One of the consultants told me we could upgrade our Traveler to 9.0 without really upgrading all our environment to 9.0. Is that correct? 
Yes. 


Q29. Is there any problem with the email coming in and out if your Traveler server is at a higher level than your mail servers? 
No known issues at this time. That's actually how a lot of our customers deploy. They tend to upgrade their Traveler environment a little more quickly then maybe they do their mail servers. 


Q30. Transitioning from 853 to 9. Upgrading the version of Domino and then Traveler. Is there any issues with that? 
No, there should be no known issues. The online doc will walk you through the update process. 


Q31. Can Traveler hopefully soon also use the personal names.nsf of a user's roaming profile instead of the contact copies in the mail database for synch? 
If the roaming contacts are replicated into the servers contacts, then they would sync. Otherwise, they won't. 


Q32. Should "tell traveler cleanup" remove old entries from the LotusTraveler.nsf? 
It will run reset for the users that are "old" and weren't cleanup previously, but depending on the reset operation, it may or many not clean up the nsf....it will clean the nsf, but many people think cleanup isn't cleaning up everything and those data are there for a valid reason....but you really shouldn't need to run cleanup as that should have been done automatically, so I would recommend opening a PMR rather than running the resets (directly or indirectly through cleanup). 


Q33. I am seeing old devices in the LotusTraveler.nsf like if a user wipes their device and reinstalls trav 
Anything with a security action will be left on purpose 


Q34. I have seen that many users in the lotustraveler.nsf deleted long time back has started appearing again. Please let me know how to do clean up and how to prevent . 
You will need to open a PMR so that we can analyze what data is there and that you think shouldn't be so that we can give you a real answer on what to do next 





Feature Enhancement Requests & Roadmaps 

Q35. Is there any plan to be able to copy an email into a To Do? I can see one is able to add it to a calendar/event document. 
We have that requirement already for creating a ToDo from the mail 


Q36. Is this Android update only available through the play store or will there be an update available from the Traveler server? 
The short answer is PlayStore right now and through the server shortly. 


Q37. When will is the next planed server release? 
2014 4Q is still the plan 


Q38. What is schedule for the next IF? 
Interim Fixes for 9001 and 901 are imminent. Plan is on the order of days. 


Q39. Will there be any future Fix Packs for Traveler 8.5.3.3? 
We can't comment directly on future plans as they are always subject to change. But if you look at the related to future device support page, you will notice that the new devices aren't on 8.5.3.3, so that means it is unlikely to get much and you should plan to upgrade (for new features, performance, fixes, etc.) http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21577369 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21577369] 



Q40. Is there any plans to add functionality to reserve rooms and resources? 
Not right now. That's not currently in plan. 


Q41. Any idea when Notebook will be supported in Traveler? 
No current plans for Notebook/Journal support on Android 


Q42a. Is the Android Traveler app going to support multiple mail or calendar accounts for Traveler like the Apple device does now? 
Multiple accounts in the apps is a known requirement. You can do it at the device level with multiple accounts with their own Traveler setups. So, there is at least a partial option there now. 


Q42b. And what about mail-in databases? We use them heavily. 
The second/other account can be any user (including one that is backed by a mail-in db). 
Mail-in-dbs are available for the traveler client, just add a person document and webmail password for the mail-in-db an it will sync to a mobile device. 


Q43. Is there any plan to have a selective notification depending on email criteria such as a keyword in the subject line? I need my phone to ring when there is a keyword in the subject but not ring for any "normal" email. 
No plan for notifications at that granular a level 


Q44. Will there be an Maas360 edition of Traveler app (currently they do e.g. not support encryption). Think that this would be good idea. 
Maas360 integration for Traveler on Android and iOS (once Traveler client available) are in progress, both high priority targets for delivery in 2014 


Q45. Will you have support for either AirWatch or Soti along with MobileIron? 
Right now, our priorities around management integration with some of the different management vendors. We're initially right focusing on support for our IBM solution, which is Maas360. We do have support for MobileIron today, and we'll continue that going forward. Those are the top priorities right now. 

AirWatch is one that we've continued to look at and it's high on our priority list but there is no current plan to add support for AirWatch. 

No, we have not looked at Soti yet. 


Q46. We are on the edge of rolling out Samsung Galaxy S5 phones. As you known there is the issue with the Menu button. We use MobileIron. Do you have any specific date when the MobileIron secure app will be available? 
As you're probably aware, the app update that we just put out better addresses our compatibility with any of the devices that don't have a hard menu button on there. 

As far as the MobileIron-enabled version of our latest app update, we are working with MobileIron on that now. There's a process that we go through with them where they wrap our apk and then that's made available through their MobileIron download site. We would expect that to be available pretty shortly but I don't have an exact date. We are working with them to try to get that out as soon as possible. What we try to do is coordinate our efforts so that as we put new app updates out, the MobileIron wrap version follows shortly. We just try to firm up our final delivery before giving something to them because that does require one-off QA from both us and them. 

Long story short. Should be available very shortly. 


Q47. Will the Show Local Calendar also be available in the MobileIron container client? 
I don't think there should be any issue with/ the show local calendar being able to show your local calendaring in your Traveler calendar. 

Good question. I think it should work. We'll have to get it back from MobileIron and see if it works. They block what they block. I think they only block things that we try and expose outside of their container. In general they let us read things but not write things, so I imagine it will work. 


Q48. We do experience when we sync, when we keep up the connection to the server, when we sync we experience a poor battery life on Android devices using push technology. So we suggest that our customer use scheduled synchronization (like every 15 minutes). Are there any plans to incorporate technology like cloud messaging to push or to send a message to the client so that it will run the sync when a new message arrives on the server? 

Yes. So Google Cloud Messaging is the one we're working on now. Except it won't work with/ MobileIron. 

The improved battery life is something that we continue to look at. As you mentioned, the options for scheduled sync or manual sync are kind of the options that are there today. Google Cloud messaging is the next piece that we're working on. We are actually trying to deliver that soon although the projection is 4Q. There are some server enhancements that we need to include as part of delivering that. Our next Traveler server update is targeted for 4Q. That is the direction we're going. 

Historically MobileIron has blocked Google Messaging from its apps that it wraps. 

Let us go have some more further conversations with/ MobileIron about that and as to whether they have any plans to alleviate that restriction especially as we look to bring it forward with our Traveler app. 


Q49. When our users need to change their passwords (like on a scheduled basis). Whenever they change it on our Identity Management they need to change it on the client as well. Are there any plans to make certificate based authentication available on the IBM Traveler client? 
Certificate-based authentication is another one of those kind of high-priority requirements that we've had for a while. Right now we don't have plans to deliver that by the end of the year. The ETA for that is more targeted to the first half of 2015. 


Suggestions:  * Suggest to have "Mark Unread" in the Gesture actions as well ... and All Docs and Docs in multiple folders .... Android should be the mobile Notes Mail client. Same experience everywhere. 
 * I agree that "Mark Unread" would be good in gesture actions 
 * Suggestion to make more use of Hannover Menu and the slide in Navigator. Like in Contacts or ability to switch between mail/todo/cal

lste_webcast; STEwebcastDocument WEBCAST

ABSTRACT
 See below for materials from an Open Mic Webcast held 29 May 2013 about "What's new in IBM Notes Traveler 9". 

CONTENT
 

Presentation & Audio Recording 
OpenMic_NotesTravelerV90_20130529.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038278&aid=2]OpenMic_NotesTravelerV90_20130529.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038278&aid=1] 


Or, download the slides from FTP: 
ftp://public.dhe.ibm.com/software/lotus/info/notes/OpenMic_NotesTravelerV90_20130529.pdf [ftp://public.dhe.ibm.com/software/lotus/info/notes/OpenMic_NotesTravelerV90_20130529.pdf] 


What's New in IBM Notes Traveler 9 Open Mic May 29 2013 (edited).mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038278&aid=4]What's New in IBM Notes Traveler 9 Open Mic May 29 2013 (edited).mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038278&aid=3] 


References  * Notes Traveler Product Documentation [http://www.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpViewCategories.xsp?lookupName=Product] 
 * Notes Traveler Red Wiki [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpViewCategories.xsp?lookupName=IBM] 
 * Notes Traveler Support FAQ [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21450615] 
 * Notes Traveler Detailed System Requirements [https://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27007909] 
 * Notes Traveler Performance Technote [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21568658] 
 * Notes Traveler Cookbook [http://www.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpViewCategories.xsp?lookupName=Lotus] 
 * Notes Traveler Releases by Date [http://www.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/dx/Lotus_Notes_Traveler_APAR_listing]


Q&A 
Q. Does anyone know if Traveler 9 will be required to support iOS 7 when it is released? 
A. We will be evaluating iOS 7 as soon as we can do beta testing. It is not known yet what is in there but for previous updates from Apple, we supported immediately 

Q. Is the Journal now available for iOS devices? 
A. No journal on iOS 

Q. When will the Android client have the ability to use a certificate for a proxy server? 
A. It's on the list of requirements.. Can't commit to anything now. 

Q. Customers are asking for sync of Notes ToDo to the native iOS reminders via EAS. 
A. Development evaluated use of reminder app for Notes ToDo, but it was not a good match against customer requirements, hence the To Do app. No plans to support reminders. 

Q. With Notes Traveler HA, documentation says that it will only support up to 10,000 devices per pool and I believe 12,000 per pool in Notes 9. Are there any plans to recommend beyond those limits? 
A. Those limits are where performance gets below what we acceptable. We are constantly working to improve performance and for each release will update with latest benchmark results. 

Q. Does Notes Traveler 9 or any upcoming release support multiple user profiles on a device? 
A. Apple devices currently support this. For Android not supported in v9. There is a requirement existing for Android, but no ETA. 

Q. Does Traveler support clustered mail environments...synching with cluster replica if primary mail server is down? Does this work if Traveler is setup in a separate domain with same OU? 
A. Yes, Traveler supports mail clusters. Fail over to backup mail servers should work when Notes Traveler and user's mail files are in different domains 


Q. We have a Unified Messaging product that uses a custom Extension Manager application on the Domino server to implement a Message Waiting Indicator (MWI). We rely on the EM_NSFADDTOFOLDER and EM_NSFMARKREAD notifications but are unable to generate these notifications when the message is processed through Traveler. Is this supported with Traveler? 
A. Traveler does not use the EM_NSFxxx fields. 

Q. Does the design of the mailbox need to be upgraded to v9 to support traveler 9? We have a custom mail template. 
A. No, mail DB design would not need to be updated for Traveler. 


Q. When setting up a complete new Traveler server infrastructure, do you recommend to create a Traveler server inside the productive Lotus Domino Domain OR in a separate new Lotus Domino Domain (that can be updated much faster to newer releases)? What should be considered? 
A. See this doc for info on separate vs one domain -> Supporting multiple Lotus Domino domains [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpDocViewer.xsp?lookupName=Administering+Lotus+Notes+Traveler+8.5.3#action=openDocument&res_title=Supporting_multiple_Lotus_Domino_domains_LNT853&content=pdcontent] 


Q. If Traveler 9 is in another Domino domain - would Mail encryption still work on the device? 
A. Domino does not support ID Vault in cross domain when sending emails. But if the ID file is in the user's mail file cross domain sending encryption should work. 

Q. Can coexist Traveler servers running Domino 853 and 9 in the same Domain? 
A. Yes, no issues with different versions in same or different domains. But can not have different versions in the same HA pool. 


Q. How are marked read events propagated to the Domino server from Traveler? 
A. The unread marks just updates the Domino unread labels 

Q. If we have Traveler running on Windows Server 2003 we would first have to upgrade the server 2008 or higher before we can upgrade to Domino\Traveler 9? 
A. Yes. Need to upgrade OS to supported release first. Migration from unsupported OS documented here for Traveler --> Moving IBM Notes Traveler to a new server [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpDocViewer.xsp?lookupName=Administering+IBM+Notes+Traveler+9#action=openDocument&res_title=Moving_IBM_Notes_Traveler_to_a_new_server_A9&content=pdcontent] 


Q. I see Windows 2003 is no longer supported for installation. I see Windows 2012. But, can I install on Windows 2008? 
A. Yes, Windows 2008 still supported 


Q. Can we run Traveler 9 while still running 8.5.3 Mail servers? 
A. Yes. 

Q. Would all the mail servers in a cluster need to be on Domino 9 then, if we want Traveler on V 9? 
A. No, mail servers do not have to be upgraded to Domino 9. Only the Domino server that is hosting the Traveler 9 component Mail servers can be any version 7.0.2 or later, just the Domino server running Traveler needs to be at same level as Traveler. 

Q. Is RedHat 6 supported? 
A. Yes. 

Q. Domino+Traveler 9 is supported in Win2003 64 bits? 
A. The system requirement page has the OS supported for notes Traveler 9.0 
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038193 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27038193] 

Q. Our Traveler is currently in same domain as mail servers, if I move Traveler to a separate domain and use Directory Assistance what affect will that have on devices, for example will they need to prime sync? are there other issue I need to be aware of? 
A. No issues - as long as the Traveler server still can access the mail DBs with Manager access. The main limitation is that ID Vault will not work. 

As long as your underlying data directory is not lost (specifically the Traveler\ntsdb directory) then end users would not notice. If you run Traveler in a different domain, be aware of the vaulted ID issue with encrypted mail since Domino does not support ID vault access from other domains. And see this document -> Supporting multiple IBM Domino domains [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpDocViewer.xsp?lookupName=Administering+IBM+Notes+Traveler+9#action=openDocument&res_title=Supporting_multiple_IBM_Domino_domains_A9&content=pdcontent]. 


Q. We have a BES10 server and IBM Domino/Traveler 9 environment and are in a process of upgrading our BlackBerry devices to BB10. We are experiencing lots of problems with devices (battery life, excessive data usage, issues with email delays). After speaking to our wireless support and doing some investigation we suspect that at least part of these problems can be attributed to the environment and possibly Traveler (people using Exchange do not experience these problems). Any ideas on how to troubleshoot this from the Traveler perspective? 
A. There are no current known battery life, excessive data usage, issues w/ e-mails delays when using BES 10, BB10, w/ Traveler v9 ... best next step would be to open PMR, have IBM support deep dive on environment/issues. 


Q. What considerations are needed if you want to upgrade to Traveler 9 but have R8.5.3 mail servers? (New release of Domino install (to R9) will want to update system files like NAMES.NSF) 
A. There is not problem running Notes Traveler 9.0 with back level (8.5.3) mail servers 

Q. What happens when you upgrade the Domino server to R9? How will those upgraded db's react to the rest of the R8.5.3 environment? 
A. You don't have to upgrade the names.nsf template on the new 9.0 Notes Traveler server. You would lose some access to some new setting fields for Notes Traveler 

Q. Any support for OOO? 
A. OOO support is available today for Windows Phone devices with Traveler v9. OOO for iOS/Android currently targeted for summer release (time line subject to change), but very high priority! :) 

Q. On BlackBerry 10, OOO should work with BES10.1 and BBOS10.1. 
A. Correct. OOO is also there today for BlackBerry 

Q. What is the minimum Domino release on Mail Servers ? I have some affiliates still using release Domino 6.5, should it work with Traveler 9.0 ? 
A. Mail server minimum is 7.0.2 with at least 6.5 mail template 


Q. Does Traveler 9 support encrypted e-mail on BB10? 
A. The BB10 devices email client currently do not support Domino encrypted email 

Q. Do you need BES in order for BlackBerry devices to work with Traveler? 
A. You do not need the old BES server and you do not have to have a BES10 either. But if you run a BES10, you can provision your BB10 to have a personal and a work perimeter to enhance security. 

BES is not 'required' to use a BB10 device with Traveler 

Direct Connect is possible to the Traveler Server from BB10 devices 

Both connection types set-up for BB10 is included in the Traveler Wiki under using BB 

Q. Does Traveler 9.0 support links to database documents ? 
A. There is some doc link support starting before 9.0, but the Domino Link has to be addressable from the device. There are a number of caveats so it might not work the way you want it to. Please read this first -> Converting Notes document links to web links [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/xpDocViewer.xsp?lookupName=Administering+IBM+Notes+Traveler+9#action=openDocument&res_title=Converting_Notes_document_links_to_web_links_A9&content=pdcontent] 

Q. Has anyone experience with Web Application Firewall in front of the Traveler server. What are the URL or methods to accept ? I haven't found much documentation on that item 
A. If supporting migrated devices also allow /servlet/traveler* 

Q. Really need "Search on the server" 
A. It is a requirement and being considered for future release 

Q. NO meeting chair actions from device possible, is that valid for all kind of devices? or only Windows phone? 
A.Only Windows Phone, RT, Pro for now. Likely will come eventually. 

Q. Is there a way to push a password to a device like you can do for BES? 
A. Not with Notes Traveler since it is not a full MDM 

Q. Can you tell me if new traveler can change de date or time to the meetings ? 
A. Yes for Apple, Android, BB10 - but no for Windows Phone/RT/Pro at this time 

Q. During the BES 10 setup we found that because we're Domino shop (not integrated with Active Directory) the only way to activate BB10 device is to use the AD user login (domainame\userlogin) in the email address field. If we use email address to activate a device the process doesn't work. I was told that this is because we are using Traveler. RIM doesn't seem to have sufficient knowledge of Traveler/Domino environment. I am curious if other people have the same experience with the BB10 setup or we are alone here. Lots of problems with BB10. 
A. No. the BES10 set-up and administration is not "because you are using Traveler". Its dependency on AD, if any, is unrelated to Traveler 

Q. Is there a possibility to add mail footers to emails sent from a smartphone via Traveler? 
A. Not by Notes Traveler, but there is Domino disclaimer can add messages to all emails sent 

Q. Do BB10 devices work with Traveler 8.5x + BES 10 ? 
A. The first IBM Traveler release that supports BB10 devices is 9.0 (no prior releases). Also, it might connect depending on what version of 8 you are running, but 9 is the supported version and had all testing and fixes for BB10 in that level, not back ported 

Q. Does Traveler 9 allow the "prevent copying" setting in Notes to work on iOS and Android devices? In 8.5.3 You just get a message saying the content has to be viewed in a Notes client. 
A. Prevent copying did not change for 9.0, we are looking at enhancing this support in future 

Q. How does one get to the OOO on the iPhone? 
A. Currently it is not supported, but coming in a future release 


Q. Regarding Android Traveler client & MDM vendors. Can't use the Android Lotus Traveler client w/ MDM. Is there a plan to allow MDMs to access the backend so they can be controlled, so we don't have to use touch tone? 
A. Not yet, but working towards it. We have been working with some of the MDM providers to try to have them better integrate with us. When we went to the XPages WebAdmin, we are going to try and also have a REST API base for management for various things, because that's a logical extension of doing that and then anybody, including MDM providers, would have access to those REST APIs in order to do that. 


Q. We have a Windows 2008 64-bit 8.5.3 UP2 shop. Strictly Android & iOS at the moment. Is it worthwhile for us to go to version 9 at this point (for our shop). Most new features seem for other platforms. 
A. Potentially for the migration thing mentioned earlier for 8.5.3 to 9.0 where you're going to have to take an outage, it could be advantageous to go 9.0 now so you would have basically a smaller outage before you get as many devices. Most of the new features, you are correct, are for other device platforms so if you're not going to use those there's not an overly compelling reason to pick up new features but if you want to have Linux 64 on Domino you would have to go to 9, or some of the other features if you want the platform support. But as far as Traveler features specifically, if you're not using the new features there's not a whole lot in there that would force you to go up. 


When we had the Upgrade Packs (1 & 2) there were some considerable performance fixes that also went into those versions so we have been kind of pushing customers to get up to those versions even if they're not running HA. There have been some performance enhancements for 9 but it wasn't like the level of what we did for those Upgrade Packs. 


Q. Does it make sense to go to HA first before upgrading? Or set up everything in 9 and then go to HA? 
A. Set up on 9 and then go to HA. 

Q. Has anyone seen issues with Apple devices uploading attachments to 9? Downloading seems to have no problems. 
A. Check the HTTP Post limit set on the Domino HTTP on the traveler server. Server document there are settings for how big you can allow the post data to be. 

Q. At this time it seems that IBM is leading with it's own Traveler client on Android devices. With the success of Samsung, is there any consideration into supporting Samsung SAFE for native email on devices? 
A. Not at this time. To push for that, contact Notes Traveler Product Manager, Eric Otchet. 


Q. Guidelines for checking the Traveler logs? 
A. Main information is in the headers at the log file at the top. 

Q. What is support for To Dos and Notebook Journal functionality on BlackBerry 10 devices? 
A. At this time those are currently not supported on BlackBerry 10 devices. It's just Mail, Calendar and Contacts. 

Q. A feature with older BlackBerry devices would allow you to delete email locally on the handheld but still keep them on the server, and the same for read/unread marks. Is that something that's available with Active Sync that could be supported in the future? 
A. It is not supported now, the Active Sync protocol does not have an exact support for that, but if the device wanted to do the soft delete on the device it could just soft delete and not tell the server about the delete. 


Q. Any issues with SSO? Any concerns with how Traveler gets incorporated? From a security standpoint we'd be able to have users hit a portal, log in with the network account and depending on what access their granted, it can pass their user name and password so they don't even have to know, for example, their Web mail password which is used for Traveler. Is that going to be a foreseen issue? 
A. So, Domino of course has the single sign-on across the HTTPs that you would want enabled so it wouldn't have to authenticate depending on where it got sprayed to, but anything beyond that level would be a 3rd-party integration or potentially into the Domino Directory Assistance setup and not specific to Traveler itself. 

Q. Can you tell us what we might be able to expect from these newly supported devices regarding self-signed certificates? 
A. It will vary across the devices. Windows Phone is more tolerant of the self-signed certificates than the tablets are. There are ways that you can run cert utils and import the certificates to then use the self-signed certificates on the Windows tablet devices. In general, we recommend that you still have a real signed cert, even if you get one of the cheap ones so that it's there. 


For more information about our Open Mic webcasts, visit the IBM Collaboration Solutions Support Open Mics [http://www.ibm.com/software/lotus/support/lotus-open-mics/] page. 

RELATED INFORMATION
 Tabs missing for BlackBerry & Windows Phone on Security [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21642384]

 2013/4/9

Tech Exchange; STEwebcast; openmic call; open microphone call; discussion; conference call; customer call; ODS; NSF; functionality; issues; problems; submit; ask the experts; discuss; server; 8.5.1; open mic; questions; answers; questions and answers; q&a; replay; recording; webcast; FAQ; best practice; transcript; March 16th NEWS

ABSTRACT
 IBM will hosted an Open Mic conference call with Lotus Development and Support Engineers on 16 March 2011. 

CONTENT
Questions and Answers from the session:






Q: Is there a document which lists all ODS versions and features of each? 

A: In the Notes/Domino Upgrade Cookbook -> Deploying Domino 8.5.x servers page -> Enabling new features [http://www.lotus.com/ldd/dominowiki.nsf/dx/Page_2_Deploying_Domino_85x_servers#newfeatures] section, we have a breakdown of the features/benefits of ODS 48 and 51 and how to enable each. 




Q: Is there a way to search a server and find all templates by the "Template Name" in its database properties? 

A: Look in the catalog.nsf 




Q: Does the Automatic Corrupt Database Collection take corrupt databases off-line? What does the user get presented with if they try to access a corrupt database? 

A: The Corrupt Database Collector does not take corrupt databases off-line. On database open, when the automatic capture of corrupt databases is enabled, a copy will be made of databases that are marked corrupt. The database will be left in place to be automatically or explicitly fixed up. 

What a user sees will vary. If you have the database open and do not encounter any corruption, everything may work as you expect. If your activity takes you into the corruption, you will see failures. If you do not have the database open, then you may find you cannot open it because a FIXUP is being run on the database. You may also get an error opening the database if another user has the database open. If you are unable to run FIXUP on the database or if automatic FIXUP is enabled for the database, it may be taken offline, fixed up and brought back online. 




Q: At Lotusphere 2011, there was some indication that changes might be coming regarding separating view indexes from the NSF, can anyone talk about that? 

A: We are always looking to add value and reduce TCO for Domino. Removing view indexes from the main NSF containing the data documents and putting them into another NSF store in a potentially different location than the main NSF file is being researched as to the measurable benefits. There has been no commitment yet for this enhancement in RNext, but is still under research/discussion. 




Q: When I run maintenance tasks on Notes databases, the transaction logs will be written and I receive an error message that the "Log File is Full". Will this also happen if I bring the server offline to run the maintenance tasks? 

A: If you are seeing log file full errors, then you should open a PMR. Running the maintenance tasks with the server down may reduce the chance of a log file full, but depending on the root cause, there are no guarantees you won't see one. 




Q: How can we upgrade the folder design (ie - load convert -u) while the mail files are 99% usage but we are not allowed by corporate policy to relax the existing mail quota? Are database quotas hard number, even preventing any server maintenance tasks? 

A: The maintenance tasks will still run 




Q: Is there a server command that will identify and record all of the template versions of mail files on a server? 

A: You can build your own view in the Catalog.nsf to show all files by the templates. You can also look in the DbInheritTemplateName and DbTemplateName fields. 




Q: My Notes mail file (based on 8.0.1 template) occasionally reverts to the 6.5.4 design. It only ever happens in one server replica at a time so deleting the icon from the workspace and 'finding replica' on its cluster server resolves the display problem. This has happened about three times over the past 3-4 months. What could be the cause? 

A: There must be a 6.5.4 template on the server somewhere that is being used to replace the design. 




Q: Are there any known issues when upgrading custom Domino applications from version 7.x to 8.x? 

A: This is a question that we get when upgrading any version to any version. Make sure that you are running the latest release as there are always improvements to bugs and performance. You can check for specific bug fixes in the Fix List database [http://www.lotus.com/ldd/r5fixlist.nsf/Public?OpenView]. Every custom application is completely unique and it may work one way in the basic client and another way in the standard client or on the web. You must test all your custom apps because there is really no way for us to predict how your custom app might behave in a different version, given the infinite combination of design elements. 




Q: We get an error message when setting the Out Of Office agent "Only plain text can be used in this type of field". We thought there was a problem with the OOO profile, so we replaced that, all forms, all subforms, and all database scripts, but we still get the same error on user's mail file. Any suggestions? 

A: We have not seen that error before. Is your mail file customized, and if so, in what capacity? One guess is that someone is trying to paste in an emoticon or picture into a text field. 




Q: Are there any tools/methods to remove '"local access protection" on NSFs that were provided from an outside source when we were not provided the .ID file and/or password? 

A: There is not a way to access local access protection without the ID file. It must be decrypted before sending it to view it locally. 




Q: Is there a way to access and detach a "File" resource from an NSF using LotusScript running on a Notes client? 

A: Yes, you can use the LS NotesNoteCollection to get handle to any design element, including resources. 




Q: What server task is responsible for purging deletion stubs? 

A: This action happens on database open. 

Follow-up Q: Does the purge use a non-public API call? I've found that getModifiedNoteTable can return an error if there is a really huge number (3+ million!) of stubs and I don't know of any other way to get the stubs. 

A: The purge happens via an internal call and we check once a day to see if we should try a purge. The getModifiedNoteTable failure is due to the fragmentation in the note ids being returned. Currently we don't have an option to work around that. 




Q: Is there any issue with compacting log.nsf of the server? It increases and we need to recreate it in order to recovery its percentage used. We use 8.5.2 FP1 and 8.5.1 FP2. 

A: You can run in-place compact with the server running without issue. Or you can run compact with the server down using ncompact. 




Q: We are migrating from 7.0.3 to 8.5.2. Regarding overall capacity document counts, are they handled better in 8.5.2? We currently seem to have a lot of corruption using version R7. 

A: In general, as we go through each release, we improve our corruption detection. We never expect when you move from one major release to the next that we are going to corrupt data. We would encourage you to move from R7 to 8.5.2FP1. 

When upgrading from 7.x, there are two important disk space saving features: 

1. Data compression was introduced in 8.0.1. You have to be at minimal ODS 48 to enable data compression. There are two options. One is to compress just the design documents and the other is to compress the data documents. We use LZ1 compression on the body of documents. We see 30-50% disk savings on ODS 48.LZ1 should be enabled on attachments as well. 

2. In 8.5 we introduced Domino Attachment and Object Service (DAOS). DAOS saves significant space at the file level by sharing data identified as identical between databases (applications). For more information, see The new Lotus Domino attachment and object service [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/lotus/library/domino-green/]. 




Q: We are on version 6.5 and moving our servers to 8.5.1. Are there any issues with running ODS 43 for an extended amount of time on an 8.5.1 server? 

A: ODS 43 is supported and we are not aware of any issues. Administrators like the fact that they did not have to upgrade the ODS at the same time during a major upgrade. However, you would not get the performance features until you upgraded to the new ODS version. 




Q: When an attachment is in DAOS and a database replicates to a cluster member, if there are multiple databases with the same attachment, is the attachment only sent once to the clustermate? 

A: DAOS is independent whether or not it is participating in a cluster. In the case of when the destination has DAOS enabled, the replication will phone ahead that you already had this attachment in your DAOS repository. If so, the attachment will not be retransmitted. 




Q: My mail file is not being compacted when using compact -c with the 8.5.1FP5 server running. 

A: On occasion, when running compact -c with the server running, and new mail arrives for that mail file while the database is being modified, that can cancel the compact operation. Try to bring the server down and then compact the database to see if the size shrinks as we would expect. 




Q: We have concerns about old replicas polluting our databases after the deletion stubs are purged. Are there any best practices for protecting our databases from such occurrences? 

A: There is a new replication option feature coming in Domino 8.5.3 called Purge Integration Replication Control (PIRC). PIRC is a replication option that will prevent documents from replicating back into a database older than the purge interval. 




Q: Is there a way to analyze a database to reduce the index size? 

A: You can issue the command "show database <database name>" on the server console to see all of the views that are currently built and their size in the database. 




Q: We recently upgraded 8.0.1 to 8.5.2 on the client. We run FIXUP, UPDALL, and COMPACT once a week. We have a couple of users that never see any free space when deleting mail from the trash and archiving documents. 

A: This should be handled automatically. With the server running, try a compact -B command. This will have a better chance of succeeding. There are also hotfixes in later fix packs for issues that started in 8.5 using compact -B. 




Q: We see that some NLO files are deleted but we are not sure why they are being deleted. All of the messages get sent to an archive database which is DAOS enabled. 

A: As the documents are migrated to the archive NSF, the reference count should go down, as they are removed from the primary NSF, but should go back up as they are deposited in the archive. It should end up being the same number of references at the end. 




Q: We have two clustered 32-bit 7.0.4 servers on Windows 2003 server. Our goal is to move to two clustered 64-bit servers on Windows 2008. What is the best practice for moving databases over to the new system considering that I have two new servers? 

A: Because you are running Windows 2003, which is supported with Domino 8.5.2, I would upgrade the servers in place and make sure the upgrade is successful. When you are ready to move to the new hardware, bring one of the clustermates down and copy everything over into the same location on disk to your current drive mapping. Then rerun the installation once all of the data is moved. 




Q: We are going to change our Notes topology infrastructure from decentralized to centralized. I want to put all of our Domino 8.5.1 servers in the data center. We are concerned about the backups for information. What recommendations do you have for running compact before I backup all of the information? 

A: You could upgrade to ODS 48 and take advantage of data compression to get the files to a smaller size. The backups would be a lot easier using data compression. It is always a good idea to bring the machines down and run FIXUP and initialize one last backup and then move the data back into the data center. For running compact, using compact -d will discard the views and -n for design and -v for data compression. 




Q: We have a clustered environment and need to run compact -c. Is there another way to take a database offline without bringing down the server? 

A: For clustered servers, our recommended best practice is to bring the server down and then run compact. You will get through multiple compactions faster with the server down. However, in the Admin client there is an option to take the database offline. 




Q: All of our mail users have Designer access but our users are not able to run compact by going into application properties. The compact button is greyed out. Why is this occurring? 

A: This is by design, but we have gotten the request before for users with Designer or Editor access to be able to run compact. We have had discussions about users having quotas assigned and if someone is near quota and has freed up space, compact should happen automatically on the back-end for them without any intervention. 





For upcoming events, or Q&As from past events, see the Lotus Technical Exchange Webcasts [http://www.ibm.com/software/lotus/support/supp_tech_exch.html] page.

STERLINGPRI TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 Oracle 9i Certification for DCS 6.2 SP2 

SYMPTOM
PART: Outbound 5.0.1 SP2 DCS

Oracle 9i Certification for DCS 6.2 SP2


RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
Updated on 11/7/2003:
DCS 6.2 SP3 is intended to support Oracle 9.2 database server. Recently, oracle has announced extending support on oracle 8.1.7 by 1 year (i.e. until end of next year). Customers have stopped following us for 6.2 SP3 release after this announcement. We want to take this opportunity to certify SP3 on 8.1.7 database server. This means, that 6.2 SP3 release will work with both 9.2 server and 8.1.7 server. This will allow customers to upgrade to SP3 in phases (i.e. first upgrade app and then upgrade database server). And, we expect to obsolete SP2 quicker. We do not anticipate any issue in this certification because oracle supports 9.2 client with 8.1.7 server. This certification is expected to be a 1 week effort and we are targeting to announce DCS 6.2 SP3 release by end of next week (i.e. 11/14). 

Updated 10/10/2003:
1. Oracle 9i database server : Can it be on AIX 5L ? 
We dont see any issue on going with AIX 5L for oracle 9i. You can upgrade your database server with ORacle 9i and AIX 5L. 
2. Moving App server to AIX 5L 
Our application is a 32 bit application. AIX 5L is a 64 bit OS. However, we had several conversations with IBM regarding running 32 bit application on AIX 5L. IBM mentioned that they did not had any known issues in running a 32 bit application. Based on this information, we already have one customer currently in production (with 8 warehouses) running AIX 5L with WMS 6.2. Hence, we dont see this as an issue. However, we recommend that you talk to your IBM support before taking this decision.
3. Are there any plans to compile WMS 6.2 with 64 bit Oracle 9i client ?
Our next generation WMS (WMS 7.0) will be completely compatible with Oracle 9i, server and client side. Currently, there are no plans to make WMS 6.2 IBM/HP compatible with 64 bit Oracle 9i client. We expect our 6.2 customers to run 8.1.7.4 client with 9i server.
4. Rule based versus cost based optimization :
Our next generation WMS (WMS 7.0) uses only cost based optimization and not rule based. There are no plans to change WMS 6.2 from rule based to cost based optimization.
5. To apply 6.2 SP3, do we have to be on the latest HF ?
Yes. You should upgrade to the latest HF before applying the 6.2 SP3. However, our hot fixes are cumulative and you dont have to apply all hot fixes one by one. If you apply the latest, it will automatically apply all the previous ones.
6. When is 6.2 SP3 scheduled for release ?
It is scheduled for release by around 1st week of November 2003. This is tentative schedule. I will communicate if there are any changes to the schedule. We dont expect any change to this schedule, unless we hit some major issue in our current testing process.

Updated 10/7/2003:
Oracle 9i certification for DCS 6.2 SP2 in mid-November of 2003.

Customers will need to upgrade to 6.2 SP3 and Oracle 9i at the same time. We have not tested 6.2 SP3(Sun version) with the Oracle 8.1.7 database.

However, if you want to reduce the risk, you should first apply the latest 6.2 SP2 hotfix first. The only difference between the latest 6.2 SP2 HF (the one before 6.2 SP3) and 6.2 SP3 is that the 6.2 SP3 executables are compiled with Oracle 9i client libraries. There is no change in any functionality/logic.

Related info:
Update 9/15/2003 :
================
Current plan is "to support the 9i server but the clients will need to be 8.1.7.4"
Yantra to release "compatibility with 9i server and maintain all programs to connect thru' Oracle Client to be 8.1.7.4" 

Reason / Explanation :
================
The work around is because of limitations on Oracle and not Yantra.
Oracle does not provide 9i client libraries for 32 bit m/c on HP and IBM. Oracle provides this only for SUN.
Hence, issue is mainly for HP and IBM customers and not for SUN customers.

Oracle is not releasing oracle 9i on 32bit HP-UX and 32bit IBM-AIX platforms. 
If our customer(s) can influence oracle to release 9i on 32bit OS then Yantra can release DCS 6.2 with 9i client.

ABSTRACT
 IBM hosted an Ask the Experts Q&A session on June 3, 2014. The topic was "Managing Domino - Upgrading & Migrating." Darla Black gave a short demo and she was joined by John Paganetti and several other members of the Domino Support and Development teams for Q&A. 

CONTENT
 

Audio Replay
Upgrading & Migrating - Ask the Experts - 3 June 2014.mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27041957&aid=2]Upgrading & Migrating - Ask the Experts - 3 June 2014.mp3 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27041957&aid=1] 

 * 55:36 minutes long (materials referenced in demo are linked below) 
 * Q&A starts at 10:22



References Upgrading
