question: Have you noticed that after upgrading to a new version, environment variables set in your .bashrc are no longer being applied, leading to issues like SQL connection failures?
gold_doc:
FLASH (ALERT)

ABSTRACT
 In Streams 4.1.1.1 and 4.1.1.2 Streams jobs may not pick up the user enviroment from the streams user's .bashrc. This behavior is different from earlier releases. With these versions, when Streams is run as a system service, application environment variables must be set with streamtool. 

CONTENT
Problem Description
When running Streams as a system service with Streams releases 4.1.1.1
or 4.1.1.2, toolkits and user applications that depend on the
user environment may have various errors.
For example the database toolkit might show the following error
if it does not pick up the ODBCINI environment variable:



 * "An SQL operation failed. The SQL state is 08003, the SQL code
   is 0 and the SQL message is [unixODBC][Driver
   Manager]Connnection does not exist."
 * 

Problem Solution 

To work around the issue, set environment variables that are needed by the application directly in the instance with:  * 
   
 * streamtool setproperty
 * -d <domain> -i <instance>
   --application-ev <VARIABLE NAME>=<VARIABLE VALUE>
 * 
   


RELATED INFORMATION
 APAR IT18432 [https://www-01.ibm.com/support/entdocview.wss?uid=swg1IT18432]
doc:
netezza pda cronjob TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 How do I properly set the environment variables needed when executing utilities that require them from crontab on a PureData System for Analytics appliance? 

CAUSE
You want to run a maintenance or monitoring job via the crontab, but are having issues because one or more of the utilities or scripts require the following to be set:
NZ_USER
NZ_PASSWORD (or the cached password set via nzpassword)
NZ_DATABASE


ANSWER
Whenever a crontab job requires one or more of those environment variables to be set, you have to either reference the .bashrc in the crontab entry, or include it directly in the script. 

 
Here is an example of a crontab entry that explicitly references (i.e sources) the .bashrc:

*/10 * * * * (source /export/home/nz/.bashrc ; /nz/scripts/pg_sort_monitor.sh) 

Here is an example of a script that does its own initialization:

#!/bin/bash
. ~/.bash_profile
. ~/.bashrc
DATE=`date '+%m%d%Y'`
nz_migrate -sdb my_database \
-tdb my_database$DATE \
-thost $HOSTNAME \
-format binary \
-CreateTargetTable YES \
-CreateTargetDatabase YES \
-to your_email@company.com \
-genStats express \
> /dev/null \
2>&1 

This is the entry in the crontab file to call the script:

35 22 9 11 * /export/home/nz/scripts/clone_database.sh

DOWNLOADABLE FILES

ABSTRACT
 This page shows the fixes for IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns. 

DOWNLOAD DESCRIPTION
 

Product: IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns
Version: Fix Pack 9.1.1.4 GA Release
Date: October 16, 2015

List of Fixes
(Defect 195471)
Interact Advanced Patterns: issues due to distributed Streams environment.

(Defect 200620)
Timestamp (date) field in output issue in web connector.

(Defect 202894)
Unable to deploy when using more then one input data source with the web service connector.

(Defect 199232)
Unable to process more then 1000 rows from a profile table.

(Enhancement 200798)
Added user name/password based authentication for IBM MQ.

Issues fixed in previous fix pack on 9.1.0.x, included in this release:

9.1.1.3
None

9.1.1.2
The purpose of this FixPack is to add the following new features:

1. This FixPack adds support for Oracle 12 for both profile and system tables. To use Oracle system tables, you must perform a fresh installation of IBM Opportunity Detect 9.1.1 or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1, and then install this FixPack. Data migration from DB2 is not supported. 

2. New queue data source connectors for real time processing. To support the addition of queue connectors, the following new fields were added on the Properties tab of deployment configurations: Input mode, Input version, and Output version. 

3. Labels are now required in the Additional Information field of the Action component.

4. This FixPack upgrades IBM InfoSphere Streams to version 3.2.1.2.

This FixPack supports Active MQ version 5.11 or IBM WebSphere Message Queue version 8 for use with queue data source connectors.

Descriptions of these features have been added to the following documents.
IBM Opportunity Detect 9.1.1 Administrator's Guide
IBM Opportunity Detect 9.1.1 User's Guide

9.1.1.1
The primary purpose of this fix pack is to incorporate the LLM (Low Latency Messaging) protocol for TCP communication. This protocol increases performance by reducing the time needed both to send real-time I/O messages and to send messages between the various internal components.

(DEF 178228)
If a Weighted Counter Pattern had negative Patterns as incoming events, the action was fired twice. This issue has been fixed.

(DEF 178226)
If a Counter Pattern had negative patterns as incoming events, the action was fired twice. This issue has been fixed.

(DEF 178313)
If you applied functions in a Select where clause, the cursor position was lost and the page was refreshed. This issue has been fixed.

(DEF 180220)
Match All Patterns did not fire if a Forward Inactivity component was used as an incoming event. This issue has been fixed.

PREREQUISITES

All IBM EMM products must be at the same FixPack level.

Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns:
IBM Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns must be at version 9.1.1, or any 9.1.1 FixPack prior to 9.1.1.4.

If you use Oracle for your system tables, your version must be 9.1.1.2 or later.

Other IBM EMM products:
IBM Marketing Platform and other products must be at version 9.1.1.4.

INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS
Note: See the IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1 Installation Guide for additional information.

Task 1 - Before you begin

1. If you want to use Oracle for your Opportunity Detect system tables, ensure that you meet the following prerequisites:
- Install IBM Marketing Platform 9.1.1 with Oracle as the system tables.
- Install IBM Opportunity Detect 9.1.1 or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1,
selecting Oracle as the database and using the Manual database set up option.
At this point, you can skip the Streams installation and install the upgraded version of Streams when you install this Fix pack.
- Upgrade Marketing Platform to FixPack 9.1.1.4. 

2. Make a back up copy of the following: 
- The OpDetection folder on the Opportunity Detect Design Time server 
- The/home/streamsadmin/OpDetection folder on the Opportunity Detect Run Time server
- The database schemas used for Opportunity Detect Design Time and Run Time 

3. Ask all users to log out of IBM Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns and stop all running services, including StreamsRCS, Interact Design Service, Real Time Connector, and the Streams instance.

4. Stop all Streams instances.
streamtool stopinstance -i Your_Instance_Name

5. If you are upgrading from 9.1.1 or 9.1.1.1 do the following.
a.Remove all Streams instances. For example:
streamtool rminstance -i Your_Instance_Name
b. Install the required Streams RPMs for RHEL6.
See the topic "Required RPMs for RHEL 6 and CentOS 6 on x86_64 systems" in the IBM InfoSphere Streams Version 3.2.1 Installation and Configuration Guide.
c. Run the Streams dependency checker script. 
See the topic "Dependency checker script for InfoSphere Streams" in the IBM InfoSphere Streams Version 3.2.1 Installation and Configuration Guide. 

Task 2 - Install the IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1.4 Fix Pack

1. Run the IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1.4 FixPack installer through the IBM EMM Installer on all servers where IBM Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns is installed (Design Time and Run Time components).

NOTE: If you have a distributed Run Time environment, see the Installation Guide, Chapter 8: Configuring Opportunity Detect in a cluster, for additional steps.

For installations that use DB2 for system tables, use the same options as used during base installation, as described in the Installation Guide.

For installations that use the newly supported Oracle system tables, select Automatic database setup in the FixPack installer.

NOTE: As this is a FixPack installer, it is expected that the 9.1.1 release has already been installed on the current machine using the same user account that is running the FixPack installer. If the FixPack installer cannot find a previously installed release, contact IBM Technical Support for assistance. 

2. If you are using DB2 for your system tables and you selected Manual database setup, execute SQL scripts on the Design Time database schema after installation is complete, as follows.

If you have version 9.1.1 with no fixPacks applied, or if you have applied IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns FixPack 9.1.1.1, run the following scripts:
Migration911_FP1.sql
Migration911_FP2.sql
Migration911_FP3.sql
Migration911_FP4.sql

If you have applied IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns FixPack 9.1.1.2, run the following scripts:
Migration911_FP2.sql
Migration911_FP3.sql
Migration911_FP4.sql

These files are located under your Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns installation in the following path: 
<installation_directory>/database/<database_type>/Upgrade 
The default installation directory is OpDetection.


Task 3 - Perform manual steps required by the Streams upgrade

This FixPack upgrades Streams to version 3.2.1.2. Perform these steps only if you are upgrading from 9.1.1 OR 9.1.1.1, which uses the previous version of Streams. If your version is 9.1.1.2 o or above, you do not need to perform these steps.

1. Execute the Firststeps script as described in the Streams documentation, in the topic "Performing post-installation tasks using the InfoSphere Streams First Steps application" in the IBM InfoSphere Streams Version 3.2.1 Installation and Configuration Guide.

2. Recreate the Streams instances in your environment. You should give your new instances the same names as used in your old version. If the instances are given new names, you must to point your server groups to the new Streams instances.

3. Update the JAVA_HOME entry in the .bashrc file of streamsadmin user.
Change this:
JAVA_HOME=/opt/ibm/java-x86_64-60
to this:
JAVA_HOME=/home/streamsadmin/InfoSphereStreams/java

4. Set up ulimit parameters.
See the topic "Guidelines for configuring Linux ulimit settings for InfoSphere Streams" in the IBM InfoSphere Streams Version 3.2.1 
Installation and Configuration Guide.

5. Perform the following steps to synchronize the new Streams servers in Opportunity Detect or Interact Advanced Patterns.

a. Log in to Opportunity Detect or Interact Advanced Patterns. 
b. Navigate to Detect Settings > Server Groups. 
c. Click "Synchronize with changed streams configuration". 
If you did not change the names of your Streams instances in step 2, this action brings the new Streams instances into your server groups.
d. If you changed the names of any Streams instances in step 2, point your 
server groups to the new Streams instances.

Task 4 - Perform manual steps for Oracle

If you are using Oracle as your system table database, configure the Streams database adapters for Oracle. Use unixODBC with the Oracle driver to link Streams to the database.

Perform the following procedure. See the IBM InfoSphere Streams documentation for additional details. 

1. Only if you plan to use Oracle, configure the following environment 
variables for compiling Streams adapters with Oracle.
STREAMS_ADAPTERS_ODBC_ORACLE - Sample value: true
STREAMS_ADAPTERS_ODBC_INCPATH - Sample value: /mydir/unixodbc/include
STREAMS_ADAPTERS_ODBC_LIBPATH - Sample value: /mydir/unixodbc/lib

2. Configure the following environment variables for the runtime processes.
ODBCINI - Sample value: /mydir/odbc.ini
ORACLE_HOME - Sample value: 
/home/oracle/oracle/112client/oracle/product/12.1.0
/client_1
LD_LIBRARY_PATH - Sample value: 
If you are using static linking:
/home/oracle/oracle/112client/oracle/product/12.1.0/
client_1/lib
If you are not using static linking:
/home/oracle/oracle/112client/oracle/product/12.1.0/
client_1/lib:/mydir/unixodbc/lib

3. Create or modify an odbc.ini file located in the path specified in the ODBCINI environment variable. 
Example, where the data source name is "twins":
[twins]
Driver = /home/oracle/oracle/112client/oracle/product/12.1.0/client_1/
lib/libsqora.so.11.1
description = test
ServerName = 10.1.1.92:1521/twins.example.com
server = 10.1.1.92
port = 1521
Longs = F

NOTE: The data source name used in the connection.xml document must match the data source name in the odbc.ini file. 

Task 5 - Perform manual steps for Interact Advanced Patterns or Opportunity Detect with the Web Service 

1. If you are using Interact Advanced Patterns, and you have deployed an interactive channel, run the following update statements against your system table database. These statements set the appropriate value in the new Input mode field.

update DeploymentConfiguration set inputMode = 3;
update DeploymentHistory set inputMode = 3;

These statements set the input mode to TCP.

2. If you are using Opportunity Detect and use the Web Service connector in a Workspace, run the following update statements against your system table database.

update DeploymentConfiguration set inputMode = 2;
update DeploymentHistory set inputMode = 2;

These statements set the input mode to Web. 


Task 6 - Perform post-installation configuration if necessary

If you have installed the DB2 client in a location that is different from the default location, you must update the function.xml file as follows.

The function.xml file is located in the /home/streamsadmin/OpDetection/toolkits/unica_db_access/db.access/native.function 
directory.

a. Locate the following section in the file.
<library>
<cmn:description sampleUri=""></cmn:description>
<cmn:managedLibrary>
<cmn:lib>UnicaDatabaseAccessLib</cmn:lib>
<cmn:lib>db2</cmn:lib>
<cmn:libPath>../../impl/lib</cmn:libPath>
<cmn:libPath>/data/dbclient/DB2/lib64</cmn:libPath>
<cmn:includePath>../../impl/include</cmn:includePath>
<cmn:includePath>/data/dbclient/DB2/include</cmn:includePath>
</cmn:managedLibrary>
</library>

b. Correct the path in the following lines to reflect the location of your DB2 client.
<cmn:libPath>/data/dbclient/DB2/lib64</cmn:libPath>
and
<cmn:includePath>/data/dbclient/DB2/include</cmn:includePath>


Task 7 - Restart the IBM Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns components

1. Undeploy the Detect WAR file in the application server.

2. Stop the web application server (WebSphere).

3. Clear temp data from the web server directory. 
See Appendix A: Clean application server cache.

4. Restart the web application server.

5. Deploy the Opportunity Detect WAR file.

6. If a JAVA_HOME environment variable is defined on the Streams server where Run Time is installed, ensure that it is set to point to Java 6.

7. Ensure that the Path variable on the Streams server where Run Time is installed points to Java 6. 

8. Restart the web application server to start the IBM Marketing Platform and IBM Opportunity Detect or IBM Interact Advanced Patterns web applications. 

8. Start your Streams instance, Streams RCS, Real Time Connector, and Interact web service as described in the IBM Opportunity Detect and IBM Interact Advanced Patterns 9.1.1 Installation Guide.


Task 8 - Redeploy Interactive Channels or workspaces

1. If you are using Interact Advanced Patterns, redeploy your Interactive Channels in IBM Interact.

2. Redeploy all Opportunity Detect workspaces. .

DOWNLOAD PACKAGE

Fix pack Installers

IBM Opportunity Detect:
IBM_OpportunityDetectAndInteractAdvancedPatterns_9.1.1.4_linuxrhel64.bin

IBM EMM Installer:
IBM_Installer_9.1.1.4.sh 
IBM_Installer_9.1.1.4_linux.bin

SUBSCRIBE
You can track all active APARs for this component.

   Tabs), just
   like it used to appear in Maximo 7114
   The question marks (?) are no longer appearing at the end of the
   YORN

RELEASE NOTES

ABSTRACT
 IBM® StoredIQ® for Legal 2.0.3.2 is available. Read this document to find information about installation, product updates, compatibility issues, limitations, and known problems. 

CONTENT
StoredIQ for Legal enables you to automate your legal hold notification and compliance process, and to optimize your preservation and collection process.

ANNOUNCEMENT
The StoredIQ for Legal announcement is available at 


http://www.ibm.com/common/ssi/ShowDoc.wss?docURL=/common/ssi/rep_ca/6/897/ENUS217-406/index.html [http://www.ibm.com/common/ssi/ShowDoc.wss?docURL=/common/ssi/rep_ca/6/897/ENUS217-406/index.html]


See the announcement for the following information: 

 * Detailed product description 
 * Product-positioning statement 
 * Packaging and ordering details


For more information about V2.0.3.2, see What's new in StoredIQ for Legal V2.0.3 [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.welcome.doc/whatsnew.htm], What's changed in StoredIQ for Legal V2.0.3 [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.welcome.doc/whatschanged.htm], and Download IBM StoredIQ for Legal V2.0.3.2 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24043874]. 

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
Before you deploy IBM® StoredIQ for Legal, verify that you meet these prerequisites: 

 * At least one physical server with sufficient processor, RAM, and hard disk configuration for the planned management project. 
 * VMWare ESX or VMWare ESXi on CD/DVD or USB drive. 
 * IP addresses, cables, and physical switch ports for the VMWare ESX or VMWare ESXi interface. 
 * A virtual machine (VM) with at least 4 vCPUs, a memory of 14 GB, and a storage of 250 GB. 
 * A network connection. The ports 9443, 9043, 443, and 22 are needed for a connection between the administrative workstation and the VM. The connection to directory server, email server, and IBM StoredIQ server will be configured in StoredIQ for Legal. You can use the ports that fit your environment requirements. 


For detailed information about hardware and software compatibility, see the detailed system requirements document [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.plan.doc/p_sysreq.htm]. 

INSTALLING STOREDIQ FOR LEGAL
If you download the product from IBM Passport Advantage®, follow the directions in the download document at http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24043874 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24043874].

For installation instructions, see the topics in the section about deploying and configuring [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.deploy.doc/d_deploy.htm]in the StoredIQ for Legal documentation.

For upgrade instructions and additional migration information, check the section about upgrading [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.deploy.doc/d_upgrade.htm]. 

ISSUES, LIMITATIONS, AND WORKAROUNDS
ISSUES
At the time of publication, the following issues were known:

Although the final upgrade status shows completed, one or more individual configuration steps might have failed
Although the last entry in the upgrade log file shows upgrade completed, check the complete log file for errors, especially the sections for the SSL and SSO configuration steps. To avoid the most common configuration errors, make sure the following information is available prior to upgrading the system:


 * The value of the certificateAliasFromKeyFile configuration setting in the /home/was/certs/upload/input.cfg file must match the alias of the certificate referenced in the metadata file. 
 * The /siq/conf/saml2-idp-metadata.xml file must exist.


The upgrade log files might show SQL errors although the upgrade was completed successfully 
During the upgrade (specifically during schema initialization), the SQL errors SqlSyntaxErrorExceptionand SqlIntegrityConstraintViolationException might be written to the log files. These error messages can be ignored. 

The global hold reminder overview lists released custodians until the next reminder cycle starts 
A custodian who is released from all hold notices that participate in the current global hold reminder 
cycle will still show up on the Global Hold Reminder Overview page with the status the custodian 
had before being released from the last hold notice. However, no further follow-up messages to the global 
hold reminder will be sent to the released custodian. As soon as the next reminder cycle starts, the list of custodians is updated to reflect only those custodians who have active hold notices participating in the global hold reminder. 

LIMITATIONS
At the time of publication, the following limitations were known:

ASCII based sorting in upgraded clients
Although the new StoredIQ for Legal 2.0.3.2 client uses case-insensitive lexical sorting, clients migrated from 2.0.3 which were themselves migrated from 2.0.2.1 or earlier, will continue to use case-sensitive sorting based on the numeric character value.

Existing backup files can no longer be used after upgrade
Because of changes to the internal keystore settings, backup files created with earlier product versions cannot be used to restore data in StoredIQ for Legal 2.0.3.2. Therefore, create a new backup file as soon as you completed the upgrade.

Message editor limitations 

 * When underlining text and modifying the text color, sometimes the color is not applied to the underline. 
 * No user-specific formatting style is applied to the system variables. 
 * In Mozilla Firefox, system variables cannot be selected via keyboard operations. 
 * In Microsoft Edge, when you paste within the contents section of an interview, a hold notice, or the respective templates, the cursor jumps to the end of the page and back to the pasted text. 

WORKAROUNDS
The following workarounds to known issues are available:

Imported workflow and report definitions, import mappings, and data request forms might not work
If you import workflow and report definitions, import mappings, and data request forms that were created on a system with a StoredIQ for Legal version before Version 2.0.3.1 into a system with a later StoredIQ for Legal version, these definitions and forms might not work. 

Starting with Version 2.0.3.1, the names of newly created custom attributes internally are prefixed with "ca_". When defining custom attributes in a system with a later StoredIQ for Legal version with display names that you used for attributes referenced in definitions and forms in a StoredIQ for Legal version before Version 2.0.3.1 and reuse these definitions and forms in later versions, the names will not match. To fix this issue, edit the respective .json, .csv, .bpmn, or .rtpdesign file and update the attribute names to match the new naming scheme.

The Db2 configuration settings might not be updated during the upgrade
When upgrading from a StoredIQ for Legal version before Version 2.0.3, the Db2® configuration parameters might not be updated to the new settings. Some transactions might fail due to the limited transaction log size. As a workaround, change the settings manually by running the following commands:

runuser -l db2inst -c "/home/db2inst/sqllib/bin/db2 update db cfg for ilgdb using logfilsiz 4096"
runuser -l db2inst -c "home/db2inst/sqllib/bin/db2 update db cfg for ilgdb using logsecond 100"
runuser -l db2inst -c "/home/db2inst/sqllib/bin/db2 update db cfg for ilgdb using locktimeout 40"

Restart the StoredIQ for Legal server after changing the settings.

The upgrade to StoredIQ for Legal Version 2.0.3.2 might fail because of a docker container start error
During the upgrade, an error like the following might occur:

2017-03-10 09:12:10 Container ilg_sol_plugin_db2inst not running -> starting... 
Container ilg_sol_plugin_db2inst not running -> starting... 
Error response from daemon: open /dev/mapper/docker-253:1-134317184-14cf1dfbc32c1f986fc931782bc06ba747fd4d8baa8d9b9c3b5c9cf0f23f6c73: no such file or directory
Error: failed to start containers: ilg_sol_plugin_db2inst

In this case, the upgrade fails.
As a workaround, restart the upgrade process.

When a custodian is added to a recurring interview, the status shown on the overview page might be misleading
When a custodian is added to a recurring interview, the status of the custodian is immediately shown as Response pending - Initial even if the initial interview hasn't been sent yet. 

To determine whether the initial interview has been sent already, check the Initial interview column in the custodians list. If this column is empty, the initial interview hasn't been sent yet. If the Initial interview column contains a date, the initial interview has been sent already.


DOCUMENTATION
You can find the most current version of the product documentation at https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.welcome.doc/storediq_legal.htm [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZL2P_2.0.3/com.ibm.biq.welcome.doc/storediq_legal.htm].

ssl-max-entries; cache; sessions TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 After upgrading our IBM Tivoli Access Manager for e-business or migrating to IBM security Access Manager we have noticed a potential performance issue on some of our applications. After investigation it seems there are more SSL/TLS negotiations being completed than normal. Has something changed that may be causing these additional negotiations? 

ANSWER
A change was made in the way that WebSEAL (TAM 6.1.1 FP12 and onwards) and the Web Reverse Proxy (ISAM 7.0, 8.0, 9.0 and onwards) stores SSL/TLS session IDs per user session.

Traditionally there was only a single SSL/TLS session ID kept for each user within WebSEAL. With this additional change multiple SSL/TLS session IDs are now stored and thus the session cache has the potential to become full more quickly.

A consequence of this change, is that additional tuning of the WebSEAL ssl-max-entries configuration parameter may be required on the TAMeb, post fix pack 12, and ISAM environments. This additional tuning is particularly relevant when the junctioned applications uses applets, servlets or makes AJAX style calls..

As there are many variables that may affect this tuning there is no specific algorithm that can be provided to match all deployments, there is no one size fits all recommendation for the ssl-max-entries. The setting of this configuration option should be considered as an iterative approach increasing the value and revalidating that the increased load can now handle the inbound user load. 

Initial recommendation for tuning the ssl-max-entries configuration: 

After upgrading or adding an additional application to the deployment, if a performance issue (which can include transaction performance as well is CPU utilization) is encountered and the ssl-max-entries configuration is still set to its default value of 4096 (or even if it has been previously increased, including up to something like 40960) , start by increasing the value higher (for example, set "ssl-max-entries = 409600"). Test and check for performance during heavier usage of the environment and verify that you have seen an increase in throughput and a decrease in SSL/TLS renegotiations. If, over time, additional performance issues are encountered again, increase the ssl-max-entries configuration and adjust to match the current inbound load. The expected result from this iterative process should be increased throughput and faster response times. 


Not tuning / addressing this setting properly can lead to thrashing of SSL Session IDs, which can in turn result in:

- Higher CPU utilization
- SSL Handshake delays appearing (manifesting) as slower response times
- Timeouts of SSL Handshakes
** Rejecting connection
** Loadbalancers may mark a webseal offline, making the problem even worse, as all traffic would
then be routed to a subset of available webseals.

FLASH (ALERT)

ABSTRACT
 In Streams 4.1.1.1 and 4.1.1.2 Streams jobs may not pick up the user enviroment from the streams user's .bashrc. This behavior is different from earlier releases. With these versions, when Streams is run as a system service, application environment variables must be set with streamtool. 

CONTENT
Problem Description
When running Streams as a system service with Streams releases 4.1.1.1
or 4.1.1.2, toolkits and user applications that depend on the
user environment may have various errors.
For example the database toolkit might show the following error
if it does not pick up the ODBCINI environment variable:



 * "An SQL operation failed. The SQL state is 08003, the SQL code
   is 0 and the SQL message is [unixODBC][Driver
   Manager]Connnection does not exist."
 * 

Problem Solution 

To work around the issue, set environment variables that are needed by the application directly in the instance with:  * 
   
 * streamtool setproperty
 * -d <domain> -i <instance>
   --application-ev <VARIABLE NAME>=<VARIABLE VALUE>
 * 
   


RELATED INFORMATION
 APAR IT18432 [https://www-01.ibm.com/support/entdocview.wss?uid=swg1IT18432]
answer:
To work around the issue, set environment variables that are needed by the application directly in the instance with:  * 
   
 * streamtool setproperty
 * -d <domain> -i <instance>
   --application-ev <VARIABLE NAME>=<VARIABLE VALUE>
original_query:
Have you found that after upgrade to Streams 4.1.1.1 or 4.1.1.2, that environment variables set in your .bashrc are no longer being set? For example ODBCINI is not set for the database toolkit and you get

     An SQL operation failed. The SQL state is 08003, the SQL code
     is 0 and the SQL message is [unixODBC][Driver
     Manager]Connnection does not exist.

question: I need to understand details regarding Security Bulletin: Multiple vulnerabilities in Node.js affect IBM API Connect (CVE-2017-1000381, CVE-2017-11499). Where can I find this information?
gold_doc:
SECURITY BULLETIN

SUMMARY
 IBM API Connect has addressed Node.js vulnerabilities involving access to sensitive information and potential denial of service. 

VULNERABILITY DETAILS

CVEID:CVE-2017-1000381 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-1000381]
DESCRIPTION:c-ares could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an out-of-bounds read in the ares_parse_naptr_reply() function when parsing NAPTR responses. By sending specially crafted DNS response packet, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read memory outside of the given input buffer and cause a denial of service.
CVSS Base Score: 6.5
CVSS Temporal Score: Seehttps://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/128625 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/128625]for the current score
CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:L)

CVEID:CVE-2017-11499 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11499]
DESCRIPTION:Node.js is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a flaw related to constant HashTable seeds. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to flood the hash and cause a denial of service.
CVSS Base Score: 7.5
CVSS Temporal Score: Seehttps://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/129465 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/129465]for the current score
CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H)

doc:
TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 What backup should be done before applying a Fix Pack or interim fix over Cognos Planning ?
What is the step-by-step procedure to update Planning ? 

ANSWER
- Download the required Planning 10.1.1 fix from IBM Fix Central:
https://www-945.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=Cognos&product=ibm/Information+Management/Cognos+8+Planning&release=All&platform=Windows+32-bit,+x86&function=all [https://www-945.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=Cognos&product=ibm/Information+Management/Cognos+8+Planning&release=All&platform=Windows+32-bit,+x86&function=all]
Note that a Fix Pack (FP) can be installed over any previous versions of the same major realease, whereas an Interim Fix (IF) must be installed over a specific Fix Pack.
For example : 
10.1.1 FP7 can be installed over 10.1.1 FP3 or 10.1.1 FP5 IF1 or anything else
10.1.1 FP7 IF2 can be installed over 10.1.1 FP7 only 

- Before applying the Fix Pack or interim fix, it is recommended to perform an "Export Model and Data" from the "Tools / Deployment" menu of the CAC (Contributor Administration Console). Export everything including Analyst libraries if they are not too big, otherwise Analyst libraries may be already backed up in other ways by the admin team ; since libraries usually are on the network share, there is probably already some batch to take care of that. Check this with your IT service. 

- It is also recommended to save the current configuration for each installed component : open IBM Cognos Configuration on each Planning machine, go to "File / Export As" and save the decrypted configuration as "cogstartup_decrypt.xml". This can be useful in case of any configuration problem. 

- Stop all client and admin tools and Cognos services ("IBM Cognos" and "IBM Cognos 10 Planning"). Open Task Manager and verify there is nothing left running from the /ibm folder, in particular verify there is no cognosrcp.exe running (otherwise, just kill it using Windows Task Manager) 

- Ask the DBA to back up the current Planning Store database and all the Planning Contributor application databases. 

- One additional possible backup can be to simply make a copy of the whole /ibm directory : doing that, it would be even simpler to get back to the previous situation in case of any problem : you would jst have to rename the backup back to /ibm again. 

- Now you can apply the fix pack or interim fix : just run the \win32\issetup.exe from the installation kit and follow the instructions. If for some reason you think you may not have all necessary rights on the system (because of internal policies or Windows UAC for example) then run issetup.exe by righ-click "Run as Administrator" 

- The fix has to be run for every server machines of the architecture, and for every components installed on a given server machine. For example, if one single machine has two distinct installations (for example one for the gateway and one for the Planning Server), then the fix has to be applied two times. This is the case when the Planning gateway has been installed over an existing Cognos BI Gateway 10.2.x 32-bit (in case of mixed environment Planning 10.1.1 + Cognos BI 10.2.x) 

- Once applied, open IBM Cognos Configuration and Save the configuration, then restart services. 

- Once the servers upgraded, the FP or IF installation kit can be applied on other admin client machines where Planning Administration may be installed. 

- Contributor Web clients will be automatically updated when users reconnect to the Planning server.

Fixpack Fix Pack MDM TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 How do I discover which Fix Pack I have installed for version MDM 11.x? 

ANSWER
If you do not know which Fix Packs you have installed, please go to your WebSphere Console -> Applications -> Application Types -> Assets -> com.ibm.mdm.hub.server.app-*.eba -> Update bundle versions in this application. 
You will need to check the Deployed Version for all of the bundles. When you are looking at the versions, they will be in this format:

11.x.0.FPyyyIFzzz_<builddate>

The 11.x refers to the major version of MDM in use, for example 11.4.

The FPyyy indicates the Fix Pack for that bundle. You are looking for the highest number for the Fix Pack for all of your bundles. For example you may see a lot of your bundles have FP000 but find some that are also FP002. This would mean you have Fix Pack 2.

Not every bundle is updated when a Fix Pack is released, which explains the potential mixture of bundle FP versions.

The IFzzz indicates the iFix (interim fix) version. iFixes are "standalone" fixes distributed outside of the schedule of a full Fix Pack, typically when critical issues are discovered that require an accelerated fix release.

TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 Is IBM ECM Widgets 4.5.2 supported under WebSphere version 8.0? Are there any 
plan to support WebSphere 8.0? 

ANSWER
The answers are no to both questions. The reason being is that Business Space code (7.0.x) was not developed/tested on WAS 8. There is no plan to test and qualify Business Space code(7.0.x) on WAS 8 or later. That means ECM Widget is not supported under WAS 8.0 as well.

SUBSCRIBE TO THIS APAR
By subscribing, you receive periodic emails alerting you to the status of the APAR, along with a link to the fix after it becomes available. You can track this item individually or track all items by product.

Notify me when this APAR changes.

APAR STATUS
 * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.
    
   
   

ERROR DESCRIPTION
 *  Customer encountered several issue with the upgrade to ICO
   2.4.0.3 coming from a ICO 2.4 FP1 and the initial system was SCO
   2.3 FP1 iFix 6 without a region server.
   
   Temporary refer to the workaround to succeed with the upgrade.
   
   
    
   
   

LOCAL FIX
 *  1.     Create below directory on ICO CS4
   
   
   mkdir -p /opt/ibm/BPM/ico/tmp
   
   2.     Update SCO UI current password in hard coded ruby
   script.
   
   1st verify the password using below command and use the same
   password
   while updating cookbook.
   
   /opt/IBM/HTTPServer/bin/gskcmd -cert -list -db
   /opt/ibm/ccs/scui/etc/keystore -type JKS -pw xxxxxx
   
   knife cookbook download ihs -d /tmp/ico2403 -c
   /etc/chef/knife.rb
   
   mv /tmp/ico2403/ihs-*/ /tmp/ico2403/ihs
   
   vi /tmp/ico2403/ihs/recipes/ssl.rb
   
   Change
   
   ui_keychain_pw = "password"
   
   to
   
   ui_keychain_pw = "NEWpassword"
   
   knife cookbook upload ihs -o /tmp/ico2403 -c /etc/chef/knife.rb
   
   Run the upgrade
   
   3.     Create below directory in ICO CS4
   
   /opt/IBM/WebSphere/Toolbox/WCT
   
   5.     Update alias name for NodeDefaultKeystore in
   "extractDefaultNodeCertFromWAS1Node.erb". Follow steps from
   step2 to
   download cookbook and upload updated file.
   
   6.     Update IWD user name and password in ds-environment.
   
   7.     Update plugin.rb to create the above directory in step3
   
   
    
   
   

PROBLEM SUMMARY
 *  PROBLEM SUMMARY:
   ****************************************************************
   
   * USERS AFFECTED:
   All users of IBM Cloud Orchestrator 2.4 updated deployment
   server and documentation while updating environment which was
   initial a SCO 2.3 installation.
   
   ****************************************************************
   
   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION:
   IBM Cloud Orchestrator 2.4 fix pack update from a updated SCO
   2.3 environemnt which was upgraded to ICO 2.4 GA of ICO 2.4 FP1
   environment fails.
   
   ****************************************************************
   
   * RECOMMENDATION:
   Review the next update of SmartCloud Orchestrator 2.4
   Information Center when available (FP4), paragraph IBM Cloud
   Orchestrator 2.4.0.4 > Installing > Upgrading > Upgrading to IBM
   Cloud Orchestrator V2.4 Fix Pack 4 on distributed deployment.
   
   Use IBM Cloud Orchestrator 2.4 FP4 to upgrade.
   
   
    
   
   

PROBLEM CONCLUSION
 *  PROBLEM CONCLUSION:
   IBM Smart Cloud Orchestrator 2.3 has a different topology in
   respect of components and a different number of central servers.
   The update template coming with IBM Cloud Orchestrator 2.4 GA
   and the FP1 version missing IBM Workload Deployer related
   entries.
   Since the update template discovered from the upgrade from SCO
   2.3 to ICO 2.4 does not change over time the described problems
   needs to be cleared manually to solve this problems for upcoming
   fix packs.
   There are instructions to update the update template with the
   missing parameters as well the chef recipes are changed to make
   creation of temporary directories in the changed installation
   topology more reliable.
   A script will be provided to change all ICO system relevant
   passwords which simplifies the update since the chef environment
   does not need to change the passwords while updating in template
   and data bags.
   
   The fix for this APAR is contained in the following maintenance
   packages:
   | fix pack | IBM Cloud Orchestrator 2.4 Fix Pack 4

doc:
CPIT; Linux; idsldif2db TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 When use the CPIT to install the FileNet P8 platform, the installation is not successful and the error occurs at ITDS installation, refer to the detailed error in cpit_install_stderr.txt:

OUTPUT>========================================== 
OUTPUT>Setting Directories... 
OUTPUT>Mon Aug 11 08:20:00 SGT 2014 
OUTPUT>/opt/IBM/cpit/decompressed/TDS/tdsV6.3/tds 
ERROR>./install_tds.bin: line 1956: warning: here-document at line 1956 delimited by end-of-file (wanted `/dev/null') 
OUTPUT>ERROR: /opt/IBM/ldap/V6.3/sbin/idsldif2db not found. TDS installation failed. 
Process completed with exit code: 1 
ERROR in InvokeScripts-function - Terminate the remaining scripts. ***Aborting InvokeScripts-Install function. 

DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
From the error, it seems like a file is missing from the package (see"/opt/IBM/ldap/V6.3/sbin/idsldif2db not found. TDS installation failed."). 
If review the installTDS63.sh shell script, the script uses the following method to install ITDS: 

====================================================
cd "$DirToDecompressTo/$TDSDirName/tdsV6.3/tds" 
pwd 
InstallerName=install_tds.bin 
if [ -e $InstallerName ] ;then 
./$InstallerName -is:silent -options installTDS63.txt -is:log 
$ScriptsDir/log/installtds63.txt
====================================================

It is a ITDS 6.3 silent install and encounter the problem.


RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
The issue is caused by ITDS 6.3 doesn't support ISMP/GUI install on RHEL 6. 


1. ITDS does not support ISMP/GUI install on RHEL 6 - since RHEL 6 is released after ITDS 6.3. Refer to the link below:

Installing IBM Tivoli Directory Server Version 6.3 on RHEL 6 operating system [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21599258]

2. ITDS does not support silent install using install_tds.bin (ISMP/GUI installer). Refer to the link below:

Installing and uninstalling silently on Windows systems [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSVJJU_6.3.0/com.ibm.IBMDS.doc/install95.htm%23silent]

To silently install and uninstall on AIX®, Linux, Solaris, and HP-UX (Itanium) systems, use the operating system utilities. 

To fix this issue, please use RHEL 5 since ITDS 6.3 supports ISMP/GUI install on RHEL 5.

RELEASE NOTES

ABSTRACT
 On an AIX platform without a Common Desktop Environment (CDE), if you use VNC to connect to the X desktop to launch the Composite Platform Installation Tool (CPIT) in interactive or silent mode, you might experience a time-out error. 

CONTENT
The Installation Complete window in CPIT displays this message: Errors occurred during the installation. See the installation log for more information. 

The IBM/cpit/cpit_install_log_5.0.0.txt log displays a message similar to:

***IllegalThreadStateException - Timeout Error in monitorProcess: (12/23) installCE.sh. java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException: process hasn't exited
ERROR in InvokeScripts-function - Terminate the remaining scripts.
***Aborting InvokeScripts-Install function.

Causes

During the automatic installation and configuration of FileNet P8 Platform on AIX, the IBM Tivoli® Directory Server Instance Administration Tool launches a grid-like window. You must click this window to access the IBM Tivoli Directory Server Instance Administration Tool interface. In the interface, you must close this window by using the Close button and confirming the exit when prompted. If you do not close this window during the installation, the process times out and the FileNet P8 Platform installation is unsuccessful.

Resolving the problem

You can prevent the time-out issue by changing to one of the following approaches:


 *  Install Common Desktop Environment (CDE) before you run the installation 
 *  Use a utility other than VNC to connect to the AIX server 
 *  Use telnet to run the installation in silent mode


To recover from an unsuccessful installation caused by a time-out issue: 

If you created a backup of the server where you planned to run the installation, including all the downloaded software packages, you can restore the backup image and restart the installation. During the installation process, click the grid window to activate the IBM Tivoli Directory Server Instance Administration Tool window, and close the administration tool window by using the Close button. 


If you do not have a backup of the server, you can undo the installation to the point of the time-out issue, and rerun the installation: 
 1.  Uninstall Content Engine Server by running /opt/IBM/FileNet/ContentEngine/ce_uninstaller and deleting the /opt/IBM/FileNet/ContentEngine directory. 
 2.  Open the /opt/IBM/cpit/install-scripts/cpit.properties file for editing. 
 3.  Change all instances of .tar.gz file extensions to .tar. 
 4.  Set all values for the parameters PROCESSED_1 through PROCESSED_11 to YES. 
 5.  Set all values for the parameters PROCESSED_12 through PROCESSED_23 to NO. 
 6.  Save your changes to the /opt/IBM/cpit/install-scripts/cpit.properties file. 
 7.  Make a backup copy of the CDRoot/cpit.properties file. 
 8.  Copy the edited /opt/IBM/cpit/install-scripts/cpit.properties file to the CDRoot directory, overwriting the cpit.properties file in that location. 
 9.  Set the permission of the /opt/IBM/cpit/install-scripts directory to 777. 
 10. Restart the CPIT installation program. 
 11. When a grid-like screen displays, click the screen to activate the IBM Tivoli Directory Server Instance Administration Tool. 
 12. Close the tool by using the Close button, then clicking Yes on the exit confirmation window.

CPIT; PE 5.0.0.3 client TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 When using IBM FileNet Composite Platform Installation Tool 5.1 (CPIT) to install P8 5.1, the installation fails in half way, and threw an error. 

SYMPTOM
The error message reads " 5.0.0.3 client wan.exe can't be find".


CAUSE
As the default setting, CPIT has to install IBM Content Navigator 2.0.0, which by default embeds IBM FileNet Process Engine（PE）5.0.0.3 client, so it requires the same PE client installer for other components such as Content Engine. But the customer had PE 5.0.0 base client installer, that was why the issue occurred. 

ENVIRONMENT
IBM Navigator 2.0.0

RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
Download the PE 5.0.0.3 client installer, and reference it in the cpit.properties file, to do it:




1. open the cpit.properties in any editor tools such as notepad 

2. modify the related entry below(depend on the platform) to match with the actual name of the PE client installer. 

----------------------------
ZIP_PROD_NAME_9=FileNet Process Engine Client 5.0
LICENSE_ACCEPTED_9=TRUE
ZIP_NAME_AIX_9=pec.tar.gz
ZIP_NAME_LINUX_9=pec.tar.gz
ZIP_NAME_WIN_9=pec.zip

WebSphere Application Server's SystemOut.log will contain an exception: "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"


CAUSE
WebSphere Application Server instance ran out of Java heap space


ENVIRONMENT
Windows



DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
Review cpit_install_stdout.txt and SystemOut.log for the aforementioned exceptions and log entries



RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
1. Increase the maximum and minimum JVM heap size. 

 - Initial heap size: 512 MB 

 -Maximum heap size: 1024 MB 

2. Delete decompressed software folder to ensure there is enough space to re-run CPIT installation 

 - Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\IBM\cpit\decompressed and delete TDS, CE, WAS, WPXT folders 

 - Clear the recycling bin 

3. Replace the cpit.properties file 

 - Remove the cpit.properties file from the cpit folder where you are running the 5.2.0-CPIT-WIN.exe and replace it with the cpit.properties from C:\Program Files (x86)\IBM\cpit\install-scripts. This will allow the install to start at step 23. 

4. Run 5.2.0-CPIT-WIN

TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)

CAUSE

Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 on RHEL6; installing Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 on RHEL6 TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
 This document describes the points that you must consider when installing IBM Tivoli Directory Server Version 6.3 on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 (RHEL 6) operating system. 

RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
For a comprehensive list of the current recommended fix levels for IBM Tivoli Directory Server, see http://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=767&uid=swg27009778 [http://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=767&uid=swg27009778].
Use this document to find the following information: 

 * Prerequisites for installing Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 on RHEL 6 systems. 
 * Instructions to install Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 and upgrade to Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 fix pack 10. 
 * Known issues and their work around. 


 * #RHEL6PREREQPREREQUISITE FOR INSTALLING TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 ON RED HAT ENTERPRISE LINUX 6 (RHEL 6) OPERATING SYSTEM
   
 * #INSTALLUPGRADEFP10INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 AND UPGRADING TO TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 FIX PACK (FP) 10
   
 * #KIRHEL6KNOWN ISSUES AND THEIR WORK AROUND
   

PREREQUISITE FOR INSTALLING TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 ON RED HAT ENTERPRISE LINUX 6 (RHEL 6) OPERATING SYSTEM

 * The Korn shell (ksh) is required on Linux operating systems. 
 * Before installing Tivoli Directory Server Version 6.3 client or server packages on RHEL 6, the following prerequisite packages must be present on the RHEL 6 system.
   You must upgrade the listed packages to the latest patch levels. See the Red Hat support site at http://rhn.redhat.com [http://rhn.redhat.com] for patches for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. You must install the following packages that are included with the Linux operating system. Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6 on x86-32 (x86/IA32) platform Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6 on x86-64 (AMD64/EM64T) platform Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6 on System z Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6 on POWER System (System i and System p)  * compat-libstdc++-33 and its dependencies 
    * gcc 
    * gcc-c++ 
    * glibc 
    * glibc-common 
    * glibc-devel 
    * glibc-headers 
    * libgcc
   
    * compat-libstdc++-33 and its dependencies 
    * gcc 
    * gcc-c++ 
    * glibc 
    * glibc-common 
    * glibc-devel 
    * glibc-headers 
    * libgcc
   
    * compat-libstdc++-33 (install both 32 and 64-bit versions) and the dependencies 
    * gcc 
    * gcc-c++ 
    * glibc 
    * glibc-common 
    * glibc-devel 
    * glibc-headers 
    * libgcc
   
    * compat-libstdc++-33 and its dependencies 
    * gcc 
    * gcc-c++ 
    * glibc 
    * glibc-common 
    * glibc-devel 
    * glibc-headers 
    * libgcc
   
   
 * On RHEL 6, DB2 V9.7 FP4 is required for Tivoli Directory Server Version 6.3. To install DB2 V9.7 FP4 on RHEL6, the required minimum level of compat-libstdc++ is 1.3.1. On System z Linux, you must install the compat-libstdc++-33-3.2.3-47.3.s390x.rpm or higher version package before you install DB2.
   See the following DB2 websites for information about the DB2 prerequisites on RHEL 6.  * https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031170 [https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031170] 
    * https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/wikis/display/im/Red+Hat+Enterprise+Linux+%28RHEL%29+6+-+DB2+9.7 [https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/wikis/display/im/Red+Hat+Enterprise+Linux+%28RHEL%29+6+-+DB2+9.7]
   
   





#ibm-contentBack to top

INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 AND UPGRADING TO TIVOLI DIRECTORY SERVER VERSION 6.3 FIX PACK (FP) 10


On RHEL 6, you can install Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 using native operating system utilities only. To use Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 on RHEL 6, you must perform the following steps:  1. Install Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 General Availability (GA) version using native operating system utilities. 
 2. Upgrade DB2 V9.7 FP2 (provided with Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 GA ) to DB2 V9.7 FP4 level. 
 3. If you are using SSL or TLS enabled versions of TDS 6.3.0.10, you must install GSKit 8.0.14.14 or higher fix pack level. 
 4. Upgrade Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 GA to Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 FP 10 or higher fix pack level. See the following website for more information.  * See the readme file for the required fix pack level at http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=ibm~Tivoli&product=ibm/Tivoli/Tivoli+Directory+Server&release=All&platform=All&function=all [http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=ibm~Tivoli&product=ibm/Tivoli/Tivoli+Directory+Server&release=All&platform=All&function=all]. 
     * See http://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=767&uid=swg27009778 [http://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=767&uid=swg27009778] to obtain the latest fixes for IBM Tivoli Directory Server.
    
    


Notes:  * Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 installation using GUI installation program is not supported on RHEL 6. 
 * Tivoli Directory Server 6.3 White pages installation using GUI installation program is not supported. 
 * If you encounter an issue with the graphical user interface (GUI) tools such as the Instance Administration tool (idsxinst) and the Configuration tool (idsxcfg), use the appropriate command-line tool to complete the task.

KNOWN ISSUES AND THEIR WORK AROUND


On RHEL6 systems, the following issues were found. The tech notes with identified issues and their work around are listed.  * APARs:  * The idsbulkload command fails on RHEL 6 with GLPBLK108E error message. See the APAR IO15265 description at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO15265 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO15265] for more information. 
    * A return code, rc=-1, operations error is returned even after the ibmdirctl command starts ibmslapd on RHEL 6. See the APAR IO15910 description at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO15910 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO15910] for more information. 
    * The Instance Administration tool (idsxinst) might throw an error when setting the LOCPATH environment variable with an invalid value. See the APAR IO16724 description at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO16724 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IO16724] for more information.
   
   
 * Tech notes:  * Starting the ibmslapd or ibmdiradm process automatically using the inittab method on RHEL 6 does not work. See the tech note at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21588061 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21588061] for more information.
   
   
 * Before installing DB2 V9.7, install compat-libstdc++ package on the system, if not present. If the required compat-libstdc++ package is not found on the system, DB2 exits installation with following error messages.  * WARNING:

question: I need to understand details regarding Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer (CVE-2014-3566). Where can I find this information?
gold_doc:
SECURITY BULLETIN

SUMMARY
 SSLv3 contains a vulnerability that has been referred to as the Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption (POODLE) attack. SSLv3 is enabled in IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer. 

VULNERABILITY DETAILS
CVE-ID: CVE-2014-3566 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3566]

DESCRIPTION: IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a design error when using the SSLv3 protocol. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack could exploit this vulnerability via a POODLE (Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption) attack to decrypt SSL sessions and access the plaintext of encrypted connections.

CVSS Base Score: 4.3
CVSS Temporal Score: See https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013] for the current score
CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
CVSS Vector: (AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)

AFFECTED PRODUCTS AND VERSIONS
This vulnerability affects some versions and releases of IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer.

REMEDIATION/FIXES
IBM recommends that you review your entire environment to identify areas that enable the SSLv3 protocol and take appropriate mitigation and remediation actions. The most immediate mitigation action that can be taken is disabling SSLv3. You should verify disabling SSLv3 does not cause any compatibility issues.

Note that other related products are also affected by this vulnerability. In the context of applying fixes, you will also want to update Installation Manager to version 1.8 or later.

To fully mitigate the POODLE vulnerability for server side components, an additional fix for IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer is required (JR51720): 

 * WebSphere Integration Developer V7.5.1.2 [http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=ibm~WebSphere&product=ibm/WebSphere/IBM+Integration+Designer&release=7.5.1.2&platform=All&function=aparId&apars=JR51720] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.0.1.3 [http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=ibm~WebSphere&product=ibm/WebSphere/IBM+Integration+Designer&release=8.0.1.3&platform=All&function=aparId&apars=JR51720] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.5.0 [http://www-933.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/swg/selectFixes?parent=ibm~WebSphere&product=ibm/WebSphere/IBM+Integration+Designer&release=8.5.5&platform=All&function=aparId&apars=JR51720]

WORKAROUNDS AND MITIGATIONS
Customers who cannot or do not want to install the fix recommended in the "Remediation/Fixes" section of this security bulletin can disable the use of SSLv3 using manual configuration as described in "Workarounds and Mitigations" under the "Client configuration files" section in the following bulletin: Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects IBM WebSphere Application Server (CVE-2014-3566) [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21687173]

GET NOTIFIED ABOUT FUTURE SECURITY BULLETINS
 Subscribe to My Notifications [ http://www-01.ibm.com/software/support/einfo.html] to be notified of important product support alerts like this. 

REFERENCES
Complete CVSS v2 Guide [http://www.first.org/cvss/v2/guide] 
On-line Calculator v2 [http://nvd.nist.gov/CVSS-v2-Calculator] 
Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects IBM WebSphere Application Server (CVE-2014-3566) [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21687173] 
RELATED INFORMATION
IBM Secure Engineering Web Portal [http://www.ibm.com/security/secure-engineering/bulletins.html] 
IBM Product Security Incident Response Blog [http://www.ibm.com/blogs/psirt] 

CHANGE HISTORY
 2014-11-14- Original Version Published 

*The CVSS Environment Score is customer environment specific and will ultimately impact the Overall CVSS Score. Customers can evaluate the impact of this vulnerability in their environments by accessing the links in the Reference section of this Security Bulletin.

doc:
SECURITY BULLETIN

SUMMARY
 The RC4 “Bar Mitzvah” Attack for SSL/TLS affects IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer. 

VULNERABILITY DETAILS
CVEID: CVE-2015-2808 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-2808]
DESCRIPTION: The RC4 algorithm, as used in the TLS protocol and SSL protocol, could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to remotely expose account credentials without requiring an active man-in-the-middle session. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to retrieve credit card data or other sensitive information. This vulnerability is commonly referred to as "Bar Mitzvah Attack".
CVSS Base Score: 5
CVSS Temporal Score: See https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/101851 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/101851] for the current score
CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
CVSS Vector: (AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)

AFFECTED PRODUCTS AND VERSIONS
This vulnerability affects IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer.

REMEDIATION/FIXES
To fully mitigate these vulnerabilities, an additional fix (JR53201) is required for the following product versions: 

 * WebSphere Integration Developer V7.0.0.5 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FWebSphere+Integration+Developer&fixids=7.0.0.5-WS-IID-IFJR53201&source=SAR] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V7.5.1.2 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=7.5.1.2-WS-IID-IFJR53201&source=SAR] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.0.1.3 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.0.1.3-WS-IID-IFJR53201&source=SAR] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.0.1 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.0.1-WS-IID-IFJR53201] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.5.0 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.5.0-WS-IID-IFJR53201] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.6.0 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.6.0-WS-IID-IFJR53201]

WORKAROUNDS AND MITIGATIONS
If you are using any of the following products: 

 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.0.1 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.5.0 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.6.0


then the following steps can be used to remove RC4 from the list of available algorithms: 

Prerequisite: Before removing RC4 from the list of available algorithms, you must first install the FREAK: Factoring Attack on RSA-EXPORT keys fix. See this document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21700896] for more information. 

1. Ensure that the product is not running. 

2. Locate the java.security file used by the product from the following location: 
install folder/jdk/jre/lib/security/java.security 

3. Edit the java.security file with a text editor and locate the line: 
jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=SSLv3 

4. Add RC4 to the list of disabled algorithms, for example: 
jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=SSLv3, RC4 

5. Save the file and restart the product. 

You should verify applying this configuration change does not cause any compatibility issues. Not disabling the RC4 stream cipher will expose yourself to the attack described above. IBM recommends that you review your entire environment to identify other areas where you have enabled the RC4 stream cipher and take appropriate mitigation and remediation actions. GET NOTIFIED ABOUT FUTURE SECURITY BULLETINS
 Subscribe to My Notifications [ http://www-01.ibm.com/software/support/einfo.html] to be notified of important product support alerts like this.

SECURITY BULLETIN

SUMMARY
 There are multiple vulnerabilities in IBM SDK Java™ Technology Edition that is used by IBM Integration Designer and WebSphere Integration Developer. These issues were disclosed as part of the IBM Java SDK updates in January 2016 and includes the vulnerability commonly referred to as “SLOTH”. 

VULNERABILITY DETAILS
CVEID: CVE-2016-0475 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-0475]
DESCRIPTION: An unspecified vulnerability related to the Libraries component has partial confidentiality impact, partial integrity impact, and no availability impact.
CVSS Base Score: 5.8
CVSS Temporal Score: See https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/109946 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/109946] for the current score

To fully mitigate these vulnerabilities, an additional fix (JR55223) is required for the following product versions:


 * WebSphere Integration Developer V7.0.0.x [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FWebSphere+Integration+Developer&fixids=7.0.0.5-WS-IID-IFJR55223]

 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.0.1 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.0.1-WS-IID-IFJR55223] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.5.0 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.5.0-WS-IID-IFJR55223] 
 * IBM Integration Designer V8.5.6.0 [http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/quickorder?product=ibm%2FWebSphere%2FIBM+Integration+Designer&fixids=8.5.6.0-WS-IID-IFJR55223]

WORKAROUNDS AND MITIGATIONS
For CVE-2015-7575: 

For IBM Integration Designer V8.5.0.0 and higher, CVE-2015-7575 can be addressed by updating the /jre/lib/security/java.security file as follows (both steps are required):

1. Add MD5 to the jdk.certpath.disabledAlgorithms property, for example, jdk.certpath.disabledAlgorithms=MD2, RSA keySize < 1024, MD5
2. Add MD5withRSA to the jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms property, for example, jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=SSLv3, RC4, DH keySize < 768, MD5withRSA

For versions of IBM Integration Designer earlier than V8.5.0.0 and for WebSphere Integration Developer V7.0.0.x, Java 6 requires code changes in the JSSE component in addition to the java.security file modifications, so upgrading the JDK is the only solution.

SECURITY BULLETIN

SUMMARY
 SSLv3 contains a vulnerability that has been referred to as the Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption (POODLE) attack. SSLv3 is enabled in WebSphere Dynamic Process Edition. 

VULNERABILITY DETAILS
CVE-ID: CVE-2014-3566 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3566]

DESCRIPTION: WebSphere Dynamic Process Edition could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a design error when using the SSLv3 protocol. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack could exploit this vulnerability via a POODLE (Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption) attack to decrypt SSL sessions and access the plaintext of encrypted connections.

CVSS Base Score: 4.3
CVSS Temporal Score: See https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013] for the current score
CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
CVSS Vector: (AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)

AFFECTED PRODUCTS AND VERSIONS
This vulnerability affects some versions and releases of WebSphere Dynamic Process Edition.

REMEDIATION/FIXES
WebSphere Dynamic Process Edition completely relies on WebSphere Application Server to provide HTTPS capabilities. 


IBM recommends that customers install an interim fix for the IBM JDK to disable SSLv3. For information on the required fix, refer to the the Remediation/Fixes section in the following bulletins: 

 * Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects IBM Integration Designer (CVE-2014-3566) [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21689914] 
 * Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects WebSphere Business Services Fabric (CVE-2014-3566) [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21689152] 
 * Security Bulletin: Vulnerability in SSLv3 affects WebSphere Process Server, WebSphere Business Compass, and WebSphere Business Modeler Publishing Server (CVE-2014-3566) [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21689918]


IBM recommends that you review your entire environment to identify areas that enable the SSLv3 protocol and take appropriate mitigation and remediation actions. The most immediate mitigation action that can be taken is disabling SSLv3. You should verify disabling SSLv3 does not cause any compatibility issues. 

Note that other related products are also affected by this vulnerability. In the context of applying fixes, you will also want to update Installation Manager to version 1.8 or later. WORKAROUNDS AND MITIGATIONS
Customers who cannot or do not want to install the fix recommended in the "Remediation/Fixes" section of this security bulletin can disable the use of SSLv3 using manual configuration as described in the "Workarounds and Mitigations" section in the above bulletins.

question:
After using Maximo 7.6.0.8 from Chrome for a while (an hour?) my session became "dead". I could type in the "Find Navigation Item" box in the sidenav, but clicking on the selections went nowhere. Clicking on Sign Out didn't work, either. But there were loads of these errors in the logs for me. What's going wrong?



This dW Answers question is about an IBM document with the Title:
SECJ0371W Warning Message Additional Information
gold_doc:
session; cache; logout; login; timeout; time out; LTPA TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION
 What happens when the Security Cache, LTPA Token timeout, and session time out? 

ANSWER
Question 1 
What happens when the Security Cache times out? Will the user be asked to re-login?

Answer 1 
No. When using single sign-on (SSO), the Security Cache will refresh from the LTPA Token. If your LTPA Token is also expired, then the user will be asked to re-login. Also, the cache timeout period is reset every time that entry is hit. So, if the entry is hit 9 minutes into the 10 minute timeout period, the clock is reset at that time. So, instead of timing out in another minute, it is now reset for another 10 minutes, then if it's hit again in that time, it will get extended again. 

When using Local operating system for authentication, the user will be asked to login when the session times out, not the security cache. 

In V6.1, the Federated Repository has it's own cache settings. See the link under Related Information. 

Question 2 

 1. Using a browser, we accessed a secured application, we provided the UserID (UserA) and a valid PW (Password1). A token was created. So far everything is working fine. 
    
 2. You manually changed the password for UserA in the LTPA (LDAP or custom registry) from Password1 to Password2. 
 3. Using a new browser we accessed the application providing UserA and the new password (Password2) a token was created and again everything is working as expected. 
    
 4. Using a another new browser we accessed the application providing UserA and the old password (Password1). You were surprised to notice that a token was created and UserA was able to access the application. 


Answer 2 
The old password takes up to 1.5 times the security cache to disappear. It will also expire at the end of the LTPA token timeout. 

In IBM WebSphere Application Server V5.0.2 and later, you can purge a user from the security cache using an MBean interface. See the Related Information at the end of this article. 


Question 3 
I want to force my users to re-login after a set "inactivity timeout" period. How is WebSphere Application Server supposed to work with regard to session timeouts and LTPA timeout. Answer 3 
See the answer to this question in item 9 of the following developerWorks article:
http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/techjournal/1003_botzum/1003_botzum.html [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/techjournal/1003_botzum/1003_botzum.html]


Question 4 
If this is the case, can we expire or delete the LTPAToken cookie when the session expires? If so, what mechanism should we use? 

Answer 4
You can manually perform a form-based logout (as described in the Information Center) to request that the LTPAToken cookie be destroyed in the web browser, but within WebSphere Application Server, there is no functionality to automatically perform the form-based logout when the session times out. This would have to be performed programmatically.

RELATED INFORMATION
 Federated Repository cache settings [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSAW57_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.nd.doc/ae/uwim_ldapperfsettings.html]
Authentication cache settings [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSAW57_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.nd.doc/ae/usec_sec_domains_cache.html]

SUBSCRIBE
You can track all active APARs for this component.



APAR STATUS
 * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.
    
   
   

ERROR DESCRIPTION
 *  Behavior of Project Manager is inconsistent and not intuitive
   There are several scenarios that are asked to be fixed:
   Scenario 1:
   Clicking in Project Manager browser window makes "Secured By"
   option unavailable
   From CATIA or SolidWorks, perform SmarTeam Save operation,
   then in the Project browser of Project Manager, click on
   empty space.
   Result: the "Secured By" and other options becomes
   de-selected and unavailable.
   SETUP:
   1. Setup your environment to utilize Project-Based
   Authorizations as documented in the SmarTeam - Editor
   Administrator Guide.
   2. Create a Test Project and enable Project Based
   authorization for it.
   1. Launch SmarTeam and login to your test database with
   administrator or other user having Project Manager authority
   to your Test Project.
   2. Launch CATIA (or SolidWorks)
   3. In CATIA, connect to the SmarTeam Integration (SmarTeam ->
   Connect).
   4. Save the CATIA Product to SmarTeam as follows -
   a. SmarTeam -> Save
   ==> The Project Manager window is presented.
   b. Select the Test Project from the Projects list.
   c. Enter a file name
   d. Select the following option check-boxes:
   * Add to Desktop
   * Link to Project (selected by default)
   * Secured By
   * Propagate Security
   * Create/Update BOM
   e. Click in the empty space of the Documents Tree window
   (there can be separate click or double click)
   ==> The following selections are now un-selected -
   * Add to Desktop
   * Secured By
   * Propagate Security
   * Create/Update BOM
   ==> The following check-box selections are low lighted and no
   longer selectable -
   * Secured By
   * Propagate Security
   5. Try to select "Secured By" and "Propagate Security"
   options.
   ==> These selections remain low lighted and can not be
   selected.
   The user must Cancel the Save operation and execute it again.
   NOTES:
   Issue is not limited to CATIA Integration, also occurs with
   SolidWorks Integration.
   There is a next workaround exists, but it is not intuitive:
   5.
   a) Select needed Project / Folder and DO Uncheck / Check of
   the checkbox "Link to Project"
   After that choosing and signing any additional check-boxes in
   Project Manager is possible, any check-box is available for
   choosing:
   * Link to Project (un selected and selected firstly)
   * Add to Desktop
   * Secured By
   * Propagate Security
   * Create/Update BOM
   ==> These selections DOES NOT remain low lighted and CAN be
   selected (after re-check "Link to Project").
   The user MUST NOT Cancel the Save operation and execute it
   again.
   Please see attached movie.
   Important Notes:
   1. While clicking on the "Link to Project" box to first
   deselect it and then select it again (in the Workaround) does
   make the other check boxes available to select, but this is
   not intuitive.
   2. Clicking on blank (dead) space after setting up the
   Project Manager panel (entering the file name, selecting the
   Project, Folder, Document, etc. and making the appropriate
   check box
   selections) should always reset all selections, not some of
   them and not some of the time.
   Really, in the described in Scenario 1 case, the Project and
   Folder remain to be selected also after uncheck of "Link to
   Project", but it is not clear why and what logic is used.
   It is not clear (not intuitive), should we select them one
   more time or not after even de-select "Link to Project" in
   the Workaround?
   3. The behavior in this panel (Project Manager) is not
   consistent with clicking in the dead space in the SmarTeam
   Editor Documents Tree.
   In EDR, a click in dead space will instantly deselect
   whatever is selected in the documents Tree.
   Here in this Project Manager panel, the behavior depends on
   what order you clicked on things.
   If you click on an object in the Documents Tree just before
   clicking in dead space, the object in the Documents Tree
   remains selected, but the check boxes become unselected.
   The stray click should wipe out all selections, including the
   ones in the Document Tree, regardless of what was last
   clicked on.
   This panel should behave consistently with other SmarTeam
   panels.
   Scenario 2:
   Clicking on or near the low lighted check box "Propagate
   Security" should not toggle the "Link to Project" check box.
   Clicking near the low lighted check box "Secure By" should
   not toggle the "Link to Desktop" check box.
   In the scenario 1, after #4 if to click on or near the low
   lighted check box "Propagate Security" should not toggle the
   "Link to Project" check box, or any other field.
   In the scenario 1, after #4 if to click on or near the low
   lighted check box "Secure By" should not toggle the "Link to
   Desktop" check box, or any other field.
   And, clicking over low lighted selections should not change
   anything.
   Scenario 3:
   While performing Scenario 1 usually "Link to Project" check
   box remained to be checked after click / double click in
   project browser window.
   Sometimes it is grayed out, and sometimes it is selectable.
   It is wrong since after click "anywhere" this check box
   should be also un-selected.
   Example:
   - several cases while it is grayed out are not clear and not
   intuitive (it is not clear how to return it to be
   selectable).
   - while we are going after click "anywhere" to choose another
   Project or Folder, we do not sure what is really selected, if
   the "link to Project' was chosen all the time.
